column5:
Today has been pretty much the same with the depression. As pathetic as it sounds, I’m starting to adapt to the hopeless, apathetic feelings and little motivation. Just have to get through the next few months focusing on one day at a time, one hour a time, one minute at a time. Same as every year. (Which is also kinda bleak).
This whole week has been a mess with people renovating the other bathroom in our house. Most of it’s done, but my dad has lost his temper a lot because he’s so manic. I really hate being around him when he’s like this because it’s so triggering, even if not aimed at me. The issues I talked to my therapist about, with my mom becoming narcissistic and emotionally abusive at times, when he treats her like that it’s really obvious why because she just pretends like it didn’t happen. But it’s affecting her and her behavior and I feel so alone because i was fine with having minimal emotional ties to him, because I at least had my mom. Both of us with our own issues but I know she loves me. And maybe it’s unfair, but I resent him for her becoming someone who’s colder and narcissistic (especially when he’s around). He took the one close family tie from me. And at dinner tonight, somehow the topic of my high school principal came up, and he was ranting about how he dislikes the guy and something in me snapped. I never show him how the trauma he caused affects me because he apologized in the past. But I couldn’t take it tonight. I told him he sure didn’t act like he disliked him when in a conference about my depression, they shamed me together in front of all my teachers and counselor and I was humiliated and felt worthless. They all pitied me after that. I remember that conference so clearly, two grown men saying cruel things about my mental illness in a room full of people. It brought up feelings of worthlessness at dinner, then shame for eating at that moment, and then my dad guilted me for voicing my feelings by saying “you know I die a thousands deaths every day” like he’s the victim and I’m the monster for voicing my pain.
Nothing has changed, I still feel alone and hopeless but now my stupid ptsd is amped up on top of it. I can’t wait for him to go back to work next week. I rarely see him Monday through Friday even though we share a house, and my mom is a kinder person when he’s not around.
I just needed to vent this. Moderators, if you see this, is this the kind of thing I could call the helpline for, If I just needed someone to talk to but wasn’t in full crisis?
column9: Hi tryingtobebrave! We want to make sure you know you can contact NEDA Helpline if you need help finding more support. Please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237, open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner. Hope you are taking care, and please continue posting to the forums.

column5: Right now, I'm emotionally exhausted.   I can't find interest in anything.   What is my purpose?  Why am I here?  I feel sad.  I skipped dinner last night.  I want to skip again.
column9: Hello, we see that you're struggling with finding interest in anything and feeling exhausted, and we wanted to offer you some support. Always remember our helpline is a great resource to talk when you're feeling down or want some more resources. The NEDA Helpline's number is (800)941-2237 and is available Monday-Thursday from 9AM to 9PM ET and Friday from 9AM to 5PM ET. Please reach out to the National Suicide Prevention lifeline through phone at (800) 273-8255 or online at  https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/chat/ since you mentioned feeling suicidal. You can also reach out to IMAlive by phone at (800) 784-2433 or online at www.imalive.org Dial Help Inc. by phone is (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or go online to www.dialhelp.org Also the Crisis Textline has a specific eating disorder line if you text "NEDA" to 741-741 or go online to www.crisistextline.org We hope your week starts to get better and please continue to post here because you're always welcomed.

column5: I had my last therapy session this morning. I was barely able to drive home afterwards because I feel so hopeless. I probably shouldn’t even post under maintaining recovery because I’m not doing very well. I can feel myself giving up on everything. I really hate myself right now.
column9:
We're sorry to hear what's going on concerning your last session with that therapist and feeling hopeless. Please remember that you are welcomed to call the NEDA Helpline for someone to talk to when you're feeling down. The NEDA Helpline's number is (800)941-2237 and is available Monday-Thursday from 9AM to 9PM ET and Friday from 9AM to 5PM ET. We hope your week starts to turn around and gets better.  Below will be some other resources you might want to check out to find a new therapist or free/low-cost support, as well as other helplines that can assist you.   
We hope your week starts to get better and please continue to post to the forums!

column5:
I know this is probably a cognitive distortion from my depression, but I feel like the few people I’m really close to in my life don’t actually want anything to do with me, like I’m an annoyance to them and they’re just being nice. I also feel a lot of discord with my mom, and that’s not actually a cognitive distortion, our relationship is really complicated. She can be emotionally abusing, not intentionally and I know she’s had so much trauma in her life that she’s never dealt with and refuses to acknowledge. I have a much older friend whose son was suicidal and went inpatient, and she is so traumatized from it but getting help. In my case, my mom saved my life. I know it messed her up and though I attempted to make amends I know it still affects her so much because she never dealt with it and so I allow her to treat me poorly because I feel like I’m to blame.
But my depression is so bad now, that her rejections really hurt. She asked me why I was going to bed so early, and I told her a migraine from my jaw issue and she pushed me away and sighed in annoyance like she tends to do half the time, though the other half she does act like she cares. She doesn’t understand my depression either. She complains about the things she “has to do” every day, that I don’t contribute enough, but those things are her OCD behaviors to cope and I’m not enabling that. But she puts me down, is so negative but putting the blame on everyone else. Which it kinda is my fault so I take it.
But feeling like the other few people I’m close to hate me, is a cognitive distortion I know. But it makes me feel so alone and hopeless and makes the apathy worse. I don’t have thoughts of hurting myself, but I’m so low and struggling to take care of myself that I’m scared my psychiatrist is gonna admit me to the acute psych ward when I see her next month. I don’t even know why I’m posting this. I guess to get validation that I am worth a damn at least a tiny bit and that everyone doesn’t think I’m an annoyance.
column9: Hello, we see that you're having a hard time at the moment with feeling alone and as if you're annoying your loved ones and wanted to offer you some support. Always remember our helpline is a great resource to talk when you're feeling down or want some more resources. The NEDA Helpline's number is (800)941-2237 and is available Monday-Thursday from 9AM to 9PM ET and Friday from 9AM to 5PM ET. You can also reach out to IMAlive by phone at (800) 784-2433 or online at www.imalive.org Dial Help Inc. by phone is (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or go online to www.dialhelp.org We hope your week starts to get better and please continue to post here because you're always welcomed.

column5:
Hi
So lately I've been really confused about my eating disorder. Do I even have one?
What would you consider an eating disorder?
I feel like, because I eat what is considered a normal amount, and I don't leave out certain food groups, don't have "fear foods" etc, I don't have a real eating disorder, let alone anorexia. I am currently underweight and hate that I'm gaining weight but I feel like that is the only thing keeping me in the disorder. It's like I "want" the disorder and actively choose not to eat certain things (because it's "too easy" for me to eat them, someone who is really sick couldn't do that) or to restrict my intake instead of the other way around (wanting to get better but not being strong enough to) and now I'm really confused... is that really me wanting a disorder and choosing it everyday... or is that really my disorder trying to deceive me into believing it's me who has these thoughts???
ugh i'm so confused and I don't know if anyone understands what I'm trying to say... I hope someone does.
god, i hate being so confused.
column9: We noticed that you are confused about the point you are in concerning recovery and if you still have an eating disorder. We are unable to give you an answer on that but we are able to provide you information on the different stages one might experience through recovery and a screening tool that's offered on the site.  https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/stages-recovery https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/screening-tool Please remember that you are welcomed to call the NEDA Helpline for someone to talk to when you're feeling down. The NEDA Helpline's number is (800)941-2237 and is available Monday-Thursday from 9AM to 9PM ET and Friday from 9AM to 5PM ET. We hope your week starts to get better and please continue to post to the forums!

column5: So here's some background information:I've struggled with an ED ever since I suffered a severe concussion in 2014 when I was 15 years old.  Ever since then, I've been in and out of treatment countless times.  I have never had a period longer than a year of stable and full recovery without returning to treatment.  all of high school I was in and out of treatment, but still graduated somehow and got into college.  In 2017, my freshman year of college in San Diego (I live in New York) I had to go on medical leave because I relapsed.  I came back to college Spring 2018 and did well, but was still using behaviors occasionally.  Coming home to NY in the summer 2018 was great until I relapsed really badly but then came out of it fairly quickly and had a great rest of the summer.  Went back to San Diego for the first semester of my sophomore year, and I relapsed about 4 weeks into the semester.  Things got worse, and I considered going to an IOP program but didn't end up following through because I was so busy with school.  By the time I get home, I was stable but struggling a lot.  That winter things started going downhill.  I wanted to go back to SD for Spring 2019 semester, but I knew I needed support, so I planned on doing IOP out in SD.  Come the spring semester, I'm falling hard and don't even qualify for IOP.  They would only put me in PHP or residential.  I refused because I needed to keep up with my academics, so went without treatment for 1-2 months until I ended up in the hospital and had to leave school and went to residential treatment back home (this is in April 2019).  I got out of residential, come home, and the summer ended up being great at first, and then I got increasingly depressed and suicidal.  Against the advice of my doctor and therapist, I came back out to San Diego for the start of my Junior year (now currently- this fall semester 2019).  Surprisingly, I have been doing so well since I've been here. Little to no behavior use, my thoughts and urges to use behaviors and self-harm significantly decreased.  I was happy and thriving, and doing great socially and academically. My problem right now:Out of no where and suddenly I feel a tremendous amount of anxiety, depression, and desire to start losing weight again.  My thoughts have been getting significantly worse over the past 4 days.  And I used a specific behavior for the first time since August and I was so proud of myself for not using it or even having urges to.  And now, everything feels like it is collapsing around me.  All within one week.  I don't know why this is happening so fast, especially because I was doing the best I had been doing in my life.  My symptoms haven't been active for long (only 1 week) but from knowing all my past experiences, relapses happen fast and they are ugly and it seems like there is little to nothing I can do from stopping them.  I'm extremely distraught because I thought this was finally going to be the one semester I could actually enjoy and get through without actively using my eating disorder.  I feel hopeless.  At this point in my life, I feel as if relapse is always inevitable and I'm just going to have to go back to treatment eventually, get better, have a sustained period of stability, then fall again, return to treatment, stop using behaviors, live life and be stable, then relapse. Over and Over and Over again.  This has been my life.Anyways, I'm just looking for support because I don't know what I should do in this moment.  I haven't been in a hole for long BUT my gut tells me, and I have this weird feeling that everything once again is going to come crashing down around me.  Like it always does...
column9:
Hi!  Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on but it's encouraging that you want some help! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! We notice you have been experiencing a hard time lately with behaviors and feeling hopeless, along with other symptoms that are a result of an eating disorder. We realized you have taken steps towards your recovery but still wanted to inform you on resources and mention some issues that can come from an eating disorder. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• experience pain in the lower legs • complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit• experience dizziness, nausea, fever• wounds/cuts heal slowly• feel tingling in the hands or feet• blurred visionOr for any other medical concerns.  If you experience any of the above, we highly recommend seeking help from a medical professional as soon as possible.  We will attach resources that might be good for you to look into while you're not in treatment or having a difficult time. The NEDA Helpline's number is (800)941-2237 and is available Monday-Thursday from 9AM to 9PM ET and Friday from 9AM to 5PM ET. Please remember that you are welcomed to call the NEDA Helpline for someone to talk to when you're feeling down.   Below will be some other resources you might want to check out.   
We hope your week starts to turn around and please continue to post here on the forums!

column5: I battled bulimia for about two years, and I've been on the road to recovery since 2013. I no longer purge or self-harm in any form, and I'm slightly less likely to obsess over body image. My main concern is that my relationship with food is still not very healthy, and about three years into my recovery I began feeling almost invincible. I think part of me felt like I conquered bulimia and I'm invincible, and now I can eat "bad foods" however much I want without wanting to purge! I was under a lot of school/professional pressure around that time, and I ate a lot and wasn't very active. This has led to me putting on a ton of weight (don't want to mention numbers because I know that numbers can be triggers), and my body fat percentage is now in the medical range of "obese." I've had trouble getting back to a normal BF% for about three years now, and recently I'm really starting to loathe myself. I doubt I'll go back to purging, but I hate that I still loathe myself and that my ED hasn't truly gone away (because I still have a bad relationship with food). To make things worse, I'm a western girl born and raised in a part of Asia where most people are thin anyway. It's so incredibly hard not to hate yourself when you're bigger than every girl around you. Anyone going through this too? I could really use some help or advice. Thank you so much!
column9:
Hi! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about how you're feeling! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Since you mentioned past self harm and some concerning feelings so we want to provide you with some resources in case you need them in the future: 
Please continue posting!

column5: I’ve been battling with binge eating/bulimia by use of laxitives. I can do really good for about a week, then I eat and can’t seem to stop. I’ve had a therapist, but it is expensive. I probably don’t eat enough during the day, which causes me to be overly hungry, but eating X meals plus snacks seems impossible to me. After dinner tonight, I started eating some desserts. Now I feel gross and disgusted with myself and so afraid of gaining weight. Please help.
column9: Hi! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! We edited out parts of your post as specific numbers and names of food can be triggering for other members on the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Please continue posting!

column5: I’m feeling very alone. I’m losing all my treatment help. I feel hopeless. I don’t know what to do anymore. I am thankful for this forum where I can express my feelings
column9: Hi Blue44! We are really sorry to hear you feel helpless and alone right now. In addition to the forums, we want to make sure you have the information for contacting the NEDA Helpline if you need help finding more resources. Please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237, open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can also chat with us by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner. Remember that recovery is possible, take care and please continue posting!

column5: Struggling.   Don't deserve to be here.
column9: Hi, savedbygrace. We saw a more recent post said that you were doing better and we are glad to hear that. We just wanted to post resources in case you struggle through these concerning feelings:Please take care!

column5: Hello, I am recovery but i still struggle a lot with thoughts and comparing myself to others and what they eat. I cant see myself as skinny even though i am told i am. I always think i eat way more than other people. I still try and excess as much as possible and restrict my intake. But why isn't that all okay, surley the main thing is that at least i am eating, at one point i was hardly doing that. Why can that not be enough for people? Why do people always want to see numbers go up?
column9: Hi! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Remember, hope for recovery IS possible! Please continue posting!

column5: It's been a while since I've posted on here, but I'm back. I've been in recovery since February and I saw a therapist through my university for free for most of the Spring semester. Unfortunately, the school doesn't have the money to provide counseling longer than 1 semester per person so I would have to pay for a therapist myself if I try again. The thing is I didn't think I was even going to need this otherwise I would have sorted it out in the summer, but now with classes and work going on I don't have time to drive out to see a therapist in the middle of the week. I was doing really well at the end of last semester, I wasn't having any ED thoughts and I thought I would be fine this semester without any help. I started working out this summer because I work at a gym at the front desk so the membership is free and I needed something to keep me busy and out of summer depression. It started off innocent and wanting to have some muscle on my body since I lost it all from my ED. It got more unhealthy and I was going X times a week, I got some muscle definition but now that I'm in classes and can only go X times a week. I've gone back to restricting and skipping meals all the time. I know this doesn't help grow muscles which is frustrating but I am so stressed with school that I don't have time to plan out meals or grocery shop or cook for myself or think about recovery right now. I wish someone would notice and say something but my best friend is too occupied with her "boy troubles" to notice that I'm falling apart. TLDR: I'm relapsing and I don't know what to do
column9: Hello. You mentioned you were experiencing a concerning physical symptom so for precaution we are posting up some signs and symptoms to keep an eye out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• experience pain in the lower legs • complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit• experience dizziness, nausea, fever• wounds/cuts heal slowly• feel tingling in the hands or feet• blurred visionOr for any other medical concerns. If you experience anything above, we highly recommend seeking help from a medical professional as soon as possible. Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipation

column5:
I’m doing fairly well in recovery but I’m losing the will to keep fighting for it. Tomorrow I get my braces adjusted and will use liquid meals for the day, that my dietician gave me recipes for so I get enough nutrition but then Wednesday I have the opportunity to lie and use behaviors all day. For some reason, have liquid meals even though I physically need them half the time because not being able to chew much has messed up my digestion, makes the ED part of my brain go nuts. I want the comfort of behaviors so badly.
I’m tired of being in pain and fighting for recovery and trying to be positive. I don’t feel positive. I feel exhausted from all of it and it feels like recovery is too much work and not worth it anymore. The woman who adjusts my braces and my orthodontist always ask how I’m doing and try to help, but I feel like if I’m honest about how much pain I’m in, I will start crying because I feel like this has defeated me. I can’t take it much longer and yet I have months to go.
Fairly stressed about people being in the house to rmodel one of the bathrooms for the next couple days. My dad is home from work while it’s happening and the stress has caused him to start arguing with my mom and he yells so loudly sometimes at her that I hear it from across the house, it’s so triggering.
sorry for complaining so much
column9:
Hi tryingtobebrave - we’re sorry to hear you’re going through so much. You mentioned some concerning feelings, so we wanted to share these resources if you ever need to reach out for support: 
Please take care, and know that recovery is possible and worth it - YOU are worth it.
column13: Hi iwanttolive! Thank you for your heartfelt post. It had to be edited to comply with NEDA’s community guidelines (https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines). We are truly grateful for the strength and hope your faith gives you - but please remember that all religions and traditions are welcome here. Thank you again for posting such a supportive message, and for all you do to help make our forums such a kind place.

column5:
I know I have to gain weight for a lot of reasons.
-I've been told my many doctors my heart can't take it
-I'm too skinny
-My family plead with me to just eat
-I am always cold and I live in Minnesota, I am crippled by the cold and its not even winter yet
-I get a little dizzy when I stand upBut... I know I need to gain weight, but it's so hard. I get major food guilt. Which leads to restricting. Whenever I think I've eaten 'enough' I try to restrict. But the number on the scale keeps going down... But I hate feeling the guilt of gaining weight... How do I cope with seeing the number on the scale go up?
column9: Dear Miggi, thank you for posting. We wanted to reach out because you mentioned some signs of a medical emergency that demands immediate medical attention. These medical concerns include - accidentally or deliberately causing a physical injury - become suicidal - confused thinking and is not making any sense - delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren't there) -  disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are - vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea - experiencing dizziness or fainting spells - too weak to walk or collapses - painful muscle spasms - complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing - blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit - a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16 - an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute) - cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit If you’re experiencing dizziness, coldness, or any of the above, we recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. ERs are another available resource. The NEDA Helpline can be reached at 800.931.2237 Monday-Thursday 9-9 EST and Friday 9-5 EST for help in seeking more resources near you. Please take care and continue posting on the forums.

column5: Helllllloooo friend.  I have been thinking about you everyday and following a little.  I am sorry the pain is so unbearable.  If you want, I posted under s.bower and that will give you an update on me.  I miss our chats.  Please if you want, let me know how you are today.  I like that you and others still refer to you as Braveheart.  It makes me smile.  I love you and hope things are okay.  I haven't refreshed my memory today so I don't really remember what you are dealing with right now but I hope you will post back and let me know how you are.  I have really missed you.   Your friend.
column9:
Since you mentioned feeling worthless, we just wanted to post some resources in case you would like to reach out for additional support:  
Please take care!

column5: I saw my therapist yesterday. Our insurance changes November 1st so I hope to see her at least once more before the end of the month. I don’t have much motivation. My therapist thinks that I’m losing weight. I feel guilty that part of me wants to lose weight. I feel a little hopeless. I’m off my medication and the therapist appointments will be too expensive too. I feel very alone. Depression is horrible. I’m tired of living like this.
column9:
We are sorry to hear that you're struggling right now, Blue44. It sounds like you're going through a difficult time and since you mentioned some concerning feelings we just want to provide you with resources you can reach out to:  
Please take care.

column5: I’m looking for an in person support group in the Indianapolis area. Anyone have any referrals?
column9: Hello MMFan, we are happy you reached out to the forums to find more information on seeking treatment. We as an organization do not do any referrals, but we do have a map that you can type in your location to find eating disorder providers within that area.  If you would like to talk to someone from our organization over the phone to help you find more resources or just someone to talk to during this time, we have a helpline that can assist you with many options. The NEDA Helpline number is (800)931-2237 and is available Monday-Thursday from 9AM to 9PM ET, and Friday from 9AM to 5PM ET.

column5: I remember when I was restricting I would obsess and dream about my next meal. I thought that once I started eating again I wouldn't think about my next meal all the time, but I still do. Everyday, all day, I think about what my next meal will be, when it will be, and how much it will be. It keeps me up at night, and if I go out to eat I rarely focus on the person i'm with but rather on what i'll order. And if I decide to treat myself to a dessert i'll think about how I didn't need it, and feel the urge to restrict. But I can't, because if anyone saw me skip a meal, they'd be upset with me. Not only that, but the only thing that makes the obsessive thoughts go away is just plain saying, "I won't have a next meal."
column9: Hi, Miggi! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! We edited parts of your post as specific details could be triggering to other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Please continue posting!

column4: I’m done with recovery, I’ve had it .
column5: Someone at my treatment center is completely insensitive to the fact that I am transgender / nonbinary and that recovery for me will need to be different than people who don’t have that experience . The risk of having breasts after fully restoring weight would be detrimental to me . I have a hysterectomy surgery coming up next year which I have been cleared for by two doctors, the surgeon and my psychologist and got told at treatment that I cannot be allowed to make such a decision despite it being a life saving surgery as a trans person . I reached out for being suicidal and was told that I’m depressed simply because I’m malnourished . I felt so angry and humiliated and its been a whole week since this happened and I’m still upset . I want to leave the treatment center and recover on my own or with someone else .
column9:
Dear rhysbun, we are very sorry to hear about your experience. We would like to pass on some numbers since you mentioned being suicidal. This number is really important to have: (800)273-TALK(8255).  If you don't feel comfortable talking, please text "NEDA" to 741741 or visit one of these websites:
Please be safe!

column5: I think it’s important I come to terms with this. I’m definitely facing a relapse here. I kept thinking I was just having slip ups here and there and that I still had total control, but my friends and coworkers are making frequent comments about my skipping meals, so I think I need to be honest with myself. I don’t know exactly when I strayed from the path but I guess it’s been a bit of a long time coming. I’m ready to make a change and hold others accountable with me - let’s get back on track together!!
column9: Hi LastOneFastOne. Maintaining recovery is a process, and relapse is a part of that process for many. I wanted to share the link to NEDA’s page about Relapse and Recovery, check it out if you think it might be helpful - https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/learn/general-information/recovery.

column4: Feeling angry, nervous and a little hopeless
column5: My husband starts a new job soon so our health insurance will change. I’m feeling really nervous about this change. The policy has a high deductible. The plan will start November 1st. It will be expensive to continue my medicine and therapy. I’ve already canceled an appointment with my psychiatrist and I have started cutting back on my medicine. I do plan to continue therapy through October until the new plan starts. This job change had to happen because we have to have a job but I’m really angry that I will no longer have mental health help. I still struggle to eat. I’m afraid of relapse. Also I feel a little hopeless with going off my medicine. I feel very alone and depressed.

column5: I've had a slight slip-up today.  Still very depressed, which has always played a big factor in my eating habits.  Lunch was different.  Then, I had an anxiety attack after my afternoon snack, which did not put me in the best of places for going into supper.  By suppertime, I'd worked up myself into such a depressed state.  I was in my head entirely too much, and I ended up restricting, and later, I exercised more than I needed to for the day.  I'm not beating myself up about it, though.  I made it a week with no behaviors, and I'm really doing all of this on my own.  I don't have a true support system to help me with my eating disorder.  Just like everything else in my life, I'm doing this on my own.  I'm tired of feeling so alone.  Still trying, though.  Going to keep fighting.
column9: Hi Alwaysthinking - your post had to be edited a little to comply with all our community guidelines. Please refer to this link for further information on what is allowed. https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Talking about engaging in certain behaviors may be triggering for some of our users and we want to make sure all our forums stay a safe place for everyone. Thank you for understanding.

column5: Does anybody ever wish that they could just have a normal life? That they could just eat whatever they felt like eating. That they didn't have to worry about any type of disordered behavior. Just doing whatever felt right at the time. I would love to just say I don't have an eating disorder. I would love to just eat whatever I want to eat and not worry about whether it's according to some meal plan. I just want to eat because it's enjoyable. I think I'm getting more stressed trying to follow the meal plans then if I were just to eat simply because I want to be eating. I don't know; just something that's been going through my head recently.
column9: Hi alwaysthinking - your post had to be edited because you included some specifics about disordered eating and food, which can be triggering to others. You can review our Community Guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Please keep posting, take care, and remember that recovery is possible.

column5: I've been trying to fight it the past 2 days and today has just been awful. Every time I go to eat, that old anxiety just resurfaces and makes me absolutely petrified. I've been able to power through it and eat anyway but I am so frustrated that this feeling has returned so quickly. I'm not really sure why it has returned so quickly. Maybe it's because I don't have proper follow-up care. It's not like I didn't try to get that follow-up care. It's just not available in my area. I'm doing my own PHP again and I'm doing everything I can to prevent relapse and I'm just dealing with a lot of physical exhaustion which could have a lot to do with it as well. I'm not really sure why I'm having this physical exhaustion and if it continues, when I have my wellness check with my physician in a week I'm going to let him know and see what he says about it. Because it's really getting exasperating. I'm still determined and still very motivated not to let my eating disorder ruin my life anymore. I'm also very determined not to let any of my other disorders through in my life anymore. There are just some days and moments when they seem to have the upper hand. Today seems to be one of those days. I know logically that I need to be eating and I need to be eating a certain amount in order to be healthy and in order to do my Ministry. I want to be healthy. I want to be able to do my Ministry. And if I'm being completely honest, there is still a part of me that is hanging on to the other disorders and yes, the eating disorder because then if I am not healthy, if I get sick, it means I have someone to take care of me when I go into the hospital. Something I never had growing up. I've always been the caretaker. Granted, it's not the way I truly want it to be because it's not the real relationship I want to have with people. But in my distorted mind, my brain is saying I have no idea what it's like to have someone take care of me so I might as well keep getting sick to have some idea of what it's like to have somebody take care of me. I know I don't really want this. I enjoy taking care of other people. I enjoy being there for others. I feel so messed up right now. I'm tired of feeling defective. I'm tired of my life being so screwed up. I wish I knew what it's like to be normal.

My friend said it is no different than a physical health problem it’s just I get caught up in my head over it. I also have insurance concerns of course so just feeling overwhelmed. I don’t feel good about both my eating and body today. Just want tomorrow to be over.

column5:
Hello,
I am weight recovered for now about 1.5 years,but only weight restored.
I am thinking everyday about my weight and what i'll eat or not eat. Everytime i'm eating something, i'm guilty.
I am overweight since then, i have about X pounds to be where i feel the best and i am trying to loose weight healthily, with doing exercise and eating healthy and sometimes of course indulging some treats. But it leads to nothing. I am exercising and eating healthy since june of 2018 and nothing is changing, i'm still overweight and even gaining weight (that isnt muscles!). yes during summer i stopped my routine and indulged more treats but like any other girls my age, but i'm always the one to gain weight. and i feel it in my clothes and everything.
i'm afraid cause i feel that i will never be a normal young woman, that i will always have to be careful with what i eat, that i will always be the chubby one. I'm afraid cause the only answer i see in my head is going back to my dirty old habits. but in one hand i know its not the answer .
Is it normal that i cannot lose weight after my ed whatever am i doing ?
thank you.
column8: Dear alizee, we would like to
column9: Dear alizee, we would like to inform you that we edited your post to remove weight numbers, which are not allowed on the forums. You can review our community guidelines here. Thanks for your understanding and please continue to post!

column5:
Today I didnt eat all day, and thought I would be able to eat my nighttime meal without anxiety. But I instinctively went and prepared myself dinner, and by the time my eating disorder brain caught up I had already committed to eating so I did. But now I know when I eat later I will feel anxious and bad. Even though I didn't eat much, and before that hadn't eaten all day. Not really "maintaining recovery" but that's where I am.My mood has been so up and down. Last night I was miserable and hopeless, and today I was feeling ok. Caffeine strongly influences my mood for the better, but I worry about dependency so I try to only have it every few days. So not only is my mood dropping now because of food, but without caffeine tomorrow I likely won't have nearly as much of a chance at a good mood.
Lots of despair lately - I had a good few days/maybe a week, but as of last night the despair is back. I know relapsing fully wouldn't be good, but it feels like it would help at least as a distraction.

column5: I hate living with this much chronic pain. I don’t want to do this for seven more months. I want to throw away my sobriety and recovery and not feel this anymore. It’s unbearable and there’s nothing anyone can do for now, and I try so hard to keep a positive attitude but the last couple days have been relentless and I’m so done with it. I’m really sorry for being negative and while I won’t actually throw away my recoveries, I’m in a dark place emotionally and don’t want to put forth the effort either. I feel really beaten down and alone.

column5: I’m sorry I haven’t been replying to your posts the last few days. I’m having a really difficult time. The job hunt has so far been unsuccessful. I’m still very worried about my husband’s job. It’s not any security in his job. So he is also looking for a job. My anxiety has been really bad. My psychiatrist gave me a new prescription but I’m nervous about getting it filled because I might abuse the medicine especially if it were to make me drowsy. I spend a lot of time sleeping or thinking about how to escape. Life is very hard right now.  I’m also taking my frustration out on food by restricting some. Thanks for reading this. I really needed to vent.

column5: I literally just googled binge eating forums because I felt I needed to talk with people who have been through the same. This year has been very challenging for me. Whenever I try to "stay" clean the only thing that comes to my mind is food. So I usually end up having binge episodes after two or three weeks which makes me feel weak and powerless not being able to mantain a "healthy" recovery. Today was different I said. Instead of thinking about how hard is gonna be the next two weeks or the next month I will just think about one day at a time. At least tricks my mind to think is easier. No recovery is easy I know. But if I want to keep going I need to give myself a little help, because In the end I only have myslef. :)

column4: I feel like my ED will be a never-ending struggle and I don't know if I can take it
column5: One of the hardest things for me is imagining what people would think of me having an ED. I feel like i look average in weight, and i'm not saying this because I have an ED. I look at girls all the time and they are so much skinnier than me. And then I think to myself, if i was to stand next to a bunch of thin girls, I would be the last guess for "who's anorexic?." I feel like some of my friends don't even think my ED is that serious, like i don't have MAJOR mental issues. At school I do my best not to show it and out in public. But at home, it's a whole different story. I scream at my parents and siblings, cursing, crying, and screaming. I just feel like this will be a never ending struggle. I feel like I'll never feel confident and I'll always resent myself. I'm so exhausted. It's been 2 years, and I've ben on a meal plan for a year and a half of it with an Eating Disorder program.I feel like I have no control and my life is not my life. I just can't imagine how I can keep doing this, and waking up everyday to a battle. Is anyone else feeling this way, and or they felt this way in the past. I never really thought about blogging about my feelings, but I need help.
column9:

Please take care!

column4: Giving up my runs for now...
column5: It’s become dyer with my weight loss at this point and I think my next weigh in will determine weather I’m admitted into inpatient or not. I really want to avoid this as it would be detrimental to my grades. I haven’t exactly been eating more but I have stopped going for my run once a day. I doubt that run was even substantial but I still feel disgusted and angry with myself for putting a halt to this part of my exercise routine. I’m still doing high-intensity workouts X times a day but I still feel extreme guilt. How can I deal with this feeling? Should I go back to running? I feel lost and scared. Will I lose the toned look i’ve obtained? I really need some answers or link to articles that could help me with these thoughts, thanks <3

column5: Saw my therapist today it did not go well. she is at a loss I told her the dumb thing I did and she said basically she didn't know whether to drive me to the hospital or what. she asked me what I thought she should do...she is at a loss and I feel just hopeless. It's not her fault I need to do things but I am just emotionally spent. Now this week I am seeing my doctor to make sure there are no medical complications from it Tuesday then her again Wednesday and then my psychiatrist Thursday she even called my mom today. my mom saw me and didn't say much acted normal. I told a close friend and she said she always worries about losing me and she feels my therapist cares about me too and feels that way as well. I wish I could just be better for people but I can't.

column5: Sorry to keep posting. I did something really stupid the other night by accident and it could have been bad but turned out ok. I plan on telling my therapist but she is not going to be thrilled by it I know it. I was also triggered a bit by it in a way. I also am still owned by my weight like why I can't just trash my scale I don't know but I weighed myself today and I just wanted to cry. I am supposed to be gaining or I think its also a lot of trauma stuff right now. I have been very dissociative and just disconnected and feeling so many emotions over everything .I have been eating and drinking water and I just want to give up again like why it hurts I know I am getting worked up over small things. I am putting more pressure on myself at work then I need to and its just getting to me.

column5: I saw my therapist last night and she said some hard truths. I was in the hospital but it was really my own fault to be dehydrated I won't go into it fully I don't want to be triggering but I was not fully honest with the hospital about the reasons. My therapist said I did that because I knew they might admit me if they knew the real reason. She then said if I am passively suicidal and ending up in the hospital maybe I need to be in the hospital like psych wise...I don't want her to be right I don't want to be here yet again...and coming up I know far from now but Halloween is a trauma anniversary trigger and I go downhill in the seasons coming and she said this was not a good start to it. I hope to come out of this I shouldn't have lied at the hospital. Maybe I do need to be in the hospital right now but there is work of course. I already took one medical leave and here I am again only a year and a few months later...I hate myself for this
column9:

Please stay safe!
column13: For precaution we are posting up some signs and symptoms to keep an eye out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you happen to experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time • struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationPlease take care.

column4: Confused about intake and weight gain
column5:
Hello everyone
I've recently started true recovery from anorexia. By this I mean I don't exercise try not to restrict and try to eat a minimum amount a day without using a meal plan. Now I'm about two weeks into eating like this consistently, and totally freaking out. I don't have a problem eating this amount at all, in fact I often eat more. But my main concern is my weight gain. I'm just confused if I should eat like this. Also sometimes I feel like I eat unnecessarily. I sometimes am unable to decide if I want to eat or not, I mostly do eat but these situations just leave me confused and often feeling guilty. Also, if I do continue to eat this amount will I ever stop gaining weight without eating less? Or will I just want less food?
Thank you so so much for the replies.

column5: I’ve been in recovery for about 3 1/2 years, give or take. I’ve had a few backslides and relapses since but nothing that lasted longer than a couple of months. Today I found out my mother is putting down my childhood pet in two days and she wants me to be there. I’m having a bit of difficulty coping. I haven’t eaten much in the last few days as I’ve been sick, then I got this news this morning and haven’t eaten anything. It was like 6 pm when while watching TV and crying a little I got the urge to exercise so I immediately popped up and did a bunch of exercises until I was coughing so badly I catch my breath and I felt so lightheaded I was about to pass out. I instantly knew I needed help of some kind because why would I spontaneously start exercising when I haven’t eaten properly in days and am in bed with a cold. But I know it was in response to the stress and that’s just concerning because I’m going away to a different country for college in a week. I’m worried all of this accumulated stress will make me relapse as I’m needing to be at my best for school and meeting all new people. Any advice on how to avoid a serious relapse despite stress?

column5: I have my kids back in school now. I’m alone during the day now. I have looked for a job with no success. My therapist doesn’t think that I’m able to work anyway. It has been hard to eat lately. I have a lot of anxiety. My husband’s job is not very secure right now. I feel like I’m on a very slippery slope. I have already lost some since discharge from PHP/IOP. I have that anorexic thought in my head that things will be better if I lose a few more pounds. I feel like just giving up and letting the eating disorder win. Life is hard. Sometimes I feel that I don’t want to keep fighting. I have a lot of thoughts that are self destructive. Sorry that I’m being negative today.

column5: I don't think I'll say much here but. I've been wanting to relapse. I think the main thing in the way is simply that it takes effort to restrict. I guess the hope was that I can try to eat unrestricted and I don't need to worry about it if I don't see any physical changes... But that hasn't worked. I really don't feel like being in recovery right now, and I feel gross for eating anything that's not an orthorexia safe food. Life is really tough right now...

column4: Really hard time falling a sleep and Fatigue throughout day
column5: Hi! I'm new to this forum and i am writing with a question that has long gone unanswered. i will explain. i have been trying to recover for anorexia for a little over 6  months. i have reached my target weight and been trying to maintain it the best i can. Even throughout my restriction days i had a very hard falling asleep and even after eating a ton more this problem has not gone away. i lie awake for hours at a time, and even though i feel really tired i can't seem to fall asleep. At some point on the night i pass out and then wake in the morning but it really not sustainable. i feel terrible and can't sleep though the day also to make up for lost sleep. Anyone have any support to offer on this issue? i am grateful for anything at this point!

column5: Hello,I'm still trying to gain weight to keep myself out of recovery however in the past week or two it's become increasingly hard due to some troubling thoughts.It's hard enough trying to get my weight up and to be okay with seeing the number increase, even harder still is how guilty my ED voice makes me feel for eating or trying to cut back on the excessive exercising.I feel piggish and gluttonous whenever I eat and It's gotten almost impossible to cope with these feelings as I find myself shutting down when the thought's get loud.I feel like I just need to hear it from others: Is it okay to focus solely on eating and restoring my weight right now?A part of me (I like to think that this part is my more rational side) says that it is okay to be focused on this right now. But another side (the ED voice) says that it's not, and because i'm so focused on it I will gain too much weight and spiral out of control in the other direction.I really can't go back to treatment right now as school starts next week and missing more than two days will result in failed classes regardless of weather I do the work or not.I don't know what I should be focused on right now. I want to focus on my hobbies, skills, friends, personal projects, school. But a part of me feels that if I don't put a large portion of my focus towards restoring weight I won't gain what needs to be gained by next week.
column9:
Since you mentioned having some troubling thoughts we just wanted to provide you with some resources, just in case.  
Please take care!

column5: Hi,Since I've regained the weight I struggle with asthma. It feels related to eating as that's when it's worst.
column9: Hi! Thank you for posting. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines.For precaution we are posting up some signs and symptoms to keep an eye out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you happen to experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationIf you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column5:
I just had a really disheartening visit with my psychiatrist. She said if my PTSD isn’t any better by my next visit, she wants me to an IOP program for trauma.
I’ve had so much treatment for my mental health, I feel defective and a failure, more than before. It makes me feel like some hopeless case because five years ago I was in a residential program for trauma. It helped so much and I’m nowhere near where I used to be, but my symptoms keep persisting. My life is nowhere near where others my age are, I haven’t made very many of the normal “life” goals or achievements. I had finally gotten to a point where I stopped letting that bring me down, but now it’s nagging at me again because of this visit.
I feel like perhaps all the messed up things I was conditioned to believe about myself growing up were true after all. It’s really messing with my head. I feel really disappointed in myself. I want so badly to turn to drugs or eating disorder behaviors. But I’m trying to feel my way through it instead and tolerate the feelings.
Savedbygrace, I’m taking to heart what you told me last night, and accepting my feelings for what they are and meeting myself where I am instead of avoiding them/ numbing out or pretending to be fine. And it takes less energy not to fake my feelings, so thank you for that.
column9:
Hi, tryingtobebrave. We just wanted to post up some resources since you mentioned some concerning feelings.  
Please take care!

column5: I'm new to recovery and even newer to this forum.  Wondering if anyone has some books or other materials that have been really helpful for them throughout their own recovery?

column5: Doing my best with eating for once I have been doing 100% just scared if I continue I will not stop gaining I still have weight to gain but I feel I have gained too much in 3 weeks since I last see my nutritionist. I see her tomorrow and I am not nervous because I know I am doing what I am supposed to be so my therapist will be happy and so will my nutritionist. I am just trying so hard. feel I am eating so much. I hate it because people around me just don't eat the way I do like with snacks and stuff so I feel weird sometimes and when people talk about diets I hate it. I also realize I am in a different situation and it is healthy for me to gain as it is for my health. I also have a coworker who admits she has an eating disorder but posts it all over facebook and my coworkers the other day at work were talking about how she gets so stressed and stuff and they were like oh well she has an eating disorder and I wanted to be like well I have one so how do you feel about that. I am just private at work a couple people know but beyond that no one they comment on my size sometimes. this person also claims to be in recovery when her posts to me clearly state otherwise and she admitted to me privately how much she eats... also maybe her behavior in her classroom is because of it my therapist tells me I cannot do my best when I am in my eating disorder so maybe that is some I feel kind of bad my coworkers talked about it but I also felt it was a judgement on eating disorders.
column9:

Please take care!

column4: A few questions about recovery and weight gain
column5:
Hi!
My mind is once again full of questions and I was wondering whether some of you can tell me about their experiences with those things. I'm just going to list all my questions here:- How do you know you've reached your set point? Currently, I can't believe that there will come a point at which I will just stop gaining weight when I continue eating like this (loads and loads of "bad" aka high fat/calorie foods)- When is it okay to exercise so that I won't be all flabby when I am weight restored? I was never a compulsive movement - person so that is not an issue, but I know you're not supposed to exercise early in recovery.- The most important question: is it true that the more weight you gain, the better the mood will be? Will this come at a certain point or only once a healthy weight is reached? Is it just about general mood or do the feelings towards food/yourself/etc also become better or more relaxed or normal?- Is the amount of time one was underweight "linked" to the amount of time it takes for weight to redistribute evenly? -Does the amount of time someone restricted/was underweight "determine" how much food someone needs in recovery? So, does someone who restricted for a very long time need more food because there are more internal repairs to be made as opposedto someone who was only ill for a relatively short period of time?- Do things like extreme fatigue and night sweats happen to everyone? And if so, do they set in early in recovery or later?- How long until the extreme hair loss levels out? -Does one gain weight differently when eating healthy foods as opposed to "unhealthy" ones?- What is full recovery to you? What does it feel like?-Is/was there something that helped you to truly let go of the ill persona and all that comes with your eating disorder? For me personally, i feel like I can't truly let to because it would be "too easy" - i.e. someone who was really ill, couldn't just do that I do have a lot of other questions, but whenever I want to ask them I forget them, lol. But I would love to hear about your experiences regarding those I posted.
column9: Hi, fightingbee. We just wanted to post up some signs and symptoms to look out for since you mentioned some: The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsSeek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time • struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationPlease take care!

column5: Hey, everyone. Pretty new here, but I’ve been in recovery for about five years. Was just hoping to get some advice on something here. I’m still in recovery and I’ve been physically great and mostly okay emotionally, but I’ve noticed my food anxiety coming back recently. With things like alcohol or fatty foods, the anxiety is mainly because I feel like it’s everywhere and there is no consent to my part on having it be there or what is expected of me with it. It’s inescapable and I’m socially forced to interact with it in some way, for lack of a better way to explain what I feel. I’ve had my consent (in this context) breached multiple times, from parents being strict about food and refusing to believe my dietary restrictions for years to close friends insisting I’m “socially 'effed'” if I’m afraid of alcohol (their words) to an emotionally abusive friend who would constantly berate me and scrutinize everything I did. Other than forced exposure (not effective in this case, as I’m comfortable with the act of drinking and going to stuff like parties because I’m willingly going, and also it’s expensive), any other strategies to manage this anxiety and hopefully be comfortable with food and alcohol in general? Any advice or emotional support in this would be great. Thanks for listening.
column9: Hi, Pikachoo! Welcome! We are so happy you’re here. Your post had to be edited due to a swear word (not *your* words - we get it!!) - please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We also want to make sure you knew about the NEDA Helpline! In addition to these forums, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237, open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! And please continue posting. :)

column5:
Things haven't changed much here. I went to therapy tonight and my therapist apologized and seemed to inderstand why her behavior upset me - assuming a mediating role without properly hearing my feelings - although I wasnt and am not able to my feelings about it more.
I didnt speak to my dad who gave me a ride there and back. Earlier today we had some conflict... I dont need to go into detail here but he was being condescending, as are both my parents, which I told him and he apologized for. I dont like the position I'm in or how I'm being treated. Oh well.
I was woozy and tingly (bad circulation) today; I must have been undereating. I am eating now. My friend, the one who is moving away, just invited me over tomorrow and immediately I wanted to stop eating. I realize leaving the house and social situations are big triggers. I always want to restrict in anticipation of unfamiliar places and situations where I don't know what or how much I will eat. Trying to continue eating now. I really hope tomorrow I am able to be brave. My friend mentioned a drink he got today and I would love to have one but it is definitely a big fear food. I cant imagine getting  it and not "compensating" by restricting. Actually that reminds me, earlier I compensated POSITIVELY by adding more food to my snack because I knew I'd been undereating. it was only a tiny bit but a surprising victory when normally compensation is negative and restrictive. But also thats a stark contrast to how I feel now after making social plans...
It will be hard to get back on track after undereating as I have been, because that means giving up on the physical symptoms its caused which are validating and morbidly satisfying. But hopefully tomorrow I will feel committed to eating. I may need to tell myself: I still havent made up for the entire day of eating I missed!Thank you all for your support. Hope youre well.

We just wanted to post up some signs and symptoms to look out for: The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsSeek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time • struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipation Please take care!

column5: I have my stupid gynecological exam tomorrow. I really hope I get some answers as to the symptoms I’m having otherwise this is all for nothing. I’m in such a dark place right now, I just want to crawl in a hole and stay there. It occurred to be last night the potential consequences of not getting this exam sooner after something a couple years ago. I feel like I’m crawling in my skin, I hate my being in my body and I do NOT want to nourish it. Unless I binge until it hurts to punish it. Arghhh I haven’t felt this messed up in a long while. Even with the grief over my grandmas death and papa being in horrible pain from his burns, those things hurt terribly, but it didn’t make me feel like there was something fundamentally damaged and warped inside me and that I don’t deserve anything. Anyway I scheduled an appointment with my therapist for the day after on Thursday morning. I guess it’s that one spark of survival fighting to keep on my recovery journey that got me to make the appointment. Otherwise I would just keep spiraling. I’m sorry this is so negative and that I’ve been this way lately. I’m sorry if I’m being a burden.

Please take care!

column5:
Hey Everyone,
I have worked hard to stop my binge/restrict cycle, and am near a healthy weight now after years of hard work. I noticed since starting a weight lifting program i feel an urge to restrict due to the scale having natural fluctuations. My healthy mind knows that gaining is normal, but I keel feel urges to restrict. What is the best way to deal with restriction urges? I am considering journaling, self talk, and distraction like reading a fun book.I've just come so far, and I know that restricting will set me back to my previous unhealthy cycle. I don't even understand why my restriction urges started, especially since I am doing so well with my nutrition and fitness to be healthy.

column5: I don't even know how to begin. I messed up. I had gone 12 days with no eating disorder behaviors and I messed up. I was feeling frustrated and overwhelmed and very depressed and one part of me was wanting to restrict and not eat at all and instead I ended up eating with the intent of just eating a little bit and ended up overeating. And as soon as I decided that I was going to overeat , I knew that I had to take a laxative. This was not due to constipation this was a deliberate purgatory thing. Is that the right wording? Well hopefully you all know what I mean. I'm so frustrated with myself and at the same time , there's a part of me that just doesn't care. I just feel at a loss. Even though I know what the end goal is and I am a fighter and I do not want to let Satan win, I am having a really difficult time fighting him. It feels like I have the whole world on my back and I just can't do it anymore. It feels like it would be so much easier just to give in to the eating disorder and say fine take me I don't care. I was doing so well emotionally for over a month and I really thought this was the Breakthrough I've been needing and wanting forever. I don't understand this I don't know why this has happened. Today has been awful. I just want to crawl in a hole and hide their forever. I want to curl up in a ball and go nowhere and yet I already went shopping for a friend this morning and I was going to go in the ministry this afternoon but my ankle made other decisions for me. It's still giving me issues after four to five days of hurting so I finally made an appointment with my doctor to get it looked at. This evening is the day that I go to my friends' house  for dinner and the broadcasting that we'll all be watching and I'm still partly terrified about that. Everything is just snowballing around me and I really want to cave in and just say forget it I can't do it you win. And yet, I know I can't. I don't know what to do. Other than pray. Which I've been doing. And I'll continue doing. And cry. A lot. Hopefully my new therapist will have some insight on Thursday. Just really really really frustrated and totally overwhelmed
