column5: Hello friend.  How are you doing.  Being alone for the first time does bring up a number of feelings.  There were times I was with people and I was afraid that someone was in the dorm and felt scared.  So I identify with those fears.  And the fact that is has been a long time since you were left alone, it is probably natural that you will have more fear than you thought you would have.  I think it is a good thing that you are growing and learning about yourself and what you need.  There is no shame in feeling scared and realizing what a difference it makes to have someone around.  How has it been since you last posted?  Are your parent's back yet?  I am really proud of you for the way you are dealing with all that you are going through.  I am finding myself falling into a depression due to all that is going on in my life and my families life in the past months.  And more so in the past few weeks.  I did wind up overeating and feel that I lost my fourteen months of no behaviors but I know that I didn't have a full binge, I did overeat but am back on track.  Counting time for being behavior free can be a good thing but there are also some negative parts to it as we can tend to beat ourselves up if we slip a little and thing that that means we have fallen and have to start all over again.  I do not believe this but parts of me do.  In reality, what I am going through, and you as well, is meant to strengthen our faith and build character and give us more of a backbone as we firmly plant our feet on The Solid Rock.   We were never promised things would be easy.  Quite the contrary, we were promised that we would suffer various trials and sorrows, but to not lose Hope as He is with us and will help us and give us what we need as we depend on Him.I have thought of giving up lately.  But I know that is the depression talking.  I resolve to not give up and to take things one day at a time and to not start thinking, my mother just had three strokes, two minor, one not so minor, and a stint put in her main artery, due to severe blockage.  I can worry that she is going to have another stroke, or heart attack, or trust that God is in control and has my Mom, my sister, me and all our family in His hands and golly it isn't easy.  So, enough about me...how have you been doing?  You said you were struggling with thoughts of self harm.  How are those thoughts now?  Please post anytime you need support.  We are here for you.  I am so sleepy even though it isn't that late so I am going to get ready to go to sleep.  Sweet dreams my friend.
column9:
Hi, iwanttolive. Since you mention some concerning feelings we just want to post up some resources: 
Please take care!

column5: I do not recognize myself right now. I am angry, scared, and just in a consistently negative mindset. All because of this stupid exam at the doctor on Wednesday. It’s been so triggering and I’m angry and lashing out by ignoring people wanting get a hold of me because I can’t deal with anything right now and want to be left alone. I want to either binge or not eat at all. I’ve had two binges in the past week. I’m struggling with self harm urges that I thought I left behind five years ago. I’m having to use substitutes that I used to help me quit at that time- drawing on myself instead mainly. It works but I’m embarrassed because I’m an adult now and thought I would have outgrown this. I just can’t even recognize myself, I never outright ignore friends or people I care about but I don’t have it in me to connect with anyone right now. I just want to stay in my bed all day and do nothing but watch tv and sleep. Tomorrow’s big goal of the day???? Wash my hair!!! How pathetic... I just don’t like being in this mindset. I don’t want to become self destructive and go back into old patterns. I see my psychiatrist in a week.... I guess if I don’t feel better by then I’ll take her up on her suggestion to try a new antidepressant. Just needed to vent. I’m sorry I’m not around here very often like normal. I just struggle to connect. It’s like I’m watching myself even typing these words, nothing feels real. Like I’m outside my body or something, probably dissociation.
column9: Sorry you are having such a difficult time, we are glad you can use the forums to discuss this struggle. If you are in a crisis and need help immediately, text "NEDA" to 741741 to be connected with a trained volunteer at Crisis Text Line or call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). If you are currently engaging in self-harming behaviors please contact the self-injury crisis line at 1-800-366-8288.

column4: On the Verge of Falling Apart
column5: I am on the verge of completely falling apart. I am severely depressed. I can’t find a job. My husband’s job is not stable right now. My oldest daughter is about to start college. I am worried about her driving back and forth to school. It’s hard to eat. I’m trying to not go backwards. I don’t want to end up in php treatment again. Honestly, I’m just trying to not give in to my bad thoughts right now. I just feel like my life is not worth living.
column9:
Hi, Blue44. We're sorry to hear that you're struggling with these feelings. We are concerned about your safety so we want to post up some resources that you can contact.
Please take care!

column5: I’ve moreorless recovered from anorexia/orthorexia but  I’m now struggling with the opposite and finding it hard to control my eating. I want (and will) eat even when I’m not hungry. If I’m distracted it’s fine but if not and I’m on my own it feels awful and compulsive and it’ll be impossible to stop. I was feeling happier with my weight feeling a bit fuller but now I think I’m back to my pre-ED weight and I’m terrified I’m fat and that it will spiral. How do I gain control of my eating and make it so that is simply not an issue??

column5: Do you ever have one of those days when you have all sorts of things planned because you really have nothing that you need to do so you plan lots of great things to do and then something happens to completely derail you? I'm having one of those days. The last two days I had my vestibular migraines again. That's just a fancy way of saying I get vertigo whenever I get a migraine. That's why I had to see the neurologist on Monday. Anyway, because I had those migraines I had to stay in bed for the majority of the morning and got very little accomplished. I had intended to do my Ministry those mornings and couldn't. It was frustrating and I was able to stay in a good mood anyway because I knew that Jehovah God understood and I did what I had to do to take care of myself because I knew that this was not my fault and there was nothing I really could do about it except for lay down and take my medicine and wait for it to go away. So today, I had intended as long as I didn't have one of those pesky migraines again, to call on my return visits that I teach about the Bible, do some exercise, do some things for a friend, and other ways to keep myself occupied throughout the day. Instead, my ankle last night decided to change my plans for me. I twisted it or something and it has been giving me a hassle last night and today. So all I'm able to do today is rest with my ankle propped up and ice on it on and off. And while when I have my migraines I'm able to stay in a good mood, today for some reason I'm not. I'm in a crummy mood. I am bored to an extent. I know there's still activities I could be doing and it just feels like they are meaningless and I don't want to be doing them. I'm trying to stay upbeat and it's not working. Worst of all, I'm really having a lot of restriction urges. I almost didn't eat one of my meals / snacks because my stomach has been giving me fits with my on and off constipation. And then finally I was able to sorry I know gross out. And even though I just ate a sort of lunch, one part of me is wanting to eat stuff that Is not really good for me and another part is just not wanting to eat period. So this frustrates me as well and I'm going batty just staying  around the apartment all day when there's so much I could be doing and just can't because my ankle is saying no, no, no! I don't even know what I'm trying to accomplish with this post I just felt the need to vent and rant but it seems more like a ramble. Sorry. I guess my biggest reason was because of the urges to restrict and also the urges to eat stuff that I probably shouldn't. Overall, just really frustrated and hoping to get back to the wonderful place that I've been in the past few days

column5:
It seems like setting boundaries and sticking to them, and confronting my mom about her codependent issues worked! She said her and my dad will go see my grandpa for a couple days next week, and admitted that it’s fine for me to be here on my own. I hope she goes back to her codependency anonymous group, because for a while it had been helping her. She developed the issue from her first marriage and it clearly takes a toll on her.
Anyhow, I did what was right for my recovery. It’s not an easy choice to not go see my grandpa, but I trust my therapist, and don’t want to risk my recovery. He wouldn’t want me to either. Just an update. Thank you to everyone who encouraged me to stick with my boundaries and do what I needed :)

Hi, iwanttolive. Since you mentioned that you're struggling with some dark thoughts we just wanted to post up some resources in case you wanted to reach out for some support. 
Please take care!

column5: Really rough therapy session...its always hard to delve into the emotional abuse of my parents and what role they play in my eating disorder like how on vacations we will eat not in a like really normal way yet my parents are aware of my eating disorder and should know I have to eat more. My therapist pointed out a lot of things that just hurt and like she said with my sexual abuse it is easier to see it is wrong. my parents are like underhanded almost like it sneaky ways that they get to me and how they act and also with my eating disorder I always wanted them to notice me and they still don't. when I was really sick my friends brought me to the hospital not them. It's a tough subject and she pointed out things I know but it made me cry it was just hard to hear it and she really thinks I need to spend less time with them because my other abusers are out of the picture. my parents even if they can seem ok and things are ok it is not real it is fake and full of lies. it was just so hard and I have weekend plans with them for my birthday and my it is against treatment advice. it was just really hard to hear those realities and she thinks I will be able to let go of my eating disorder if I don't keep letting myself get retraumatized. like other abuse I can see the emotional stuff far more difficult to like pinpoint and say it is that bad. but my therapist said it is that bad and the more we talk about it she sees it.
column9:
Hi, hermione3. Just wanted to post up a resource in case you want to talk to someone in relation to this post.
Please take care!

column5: I've always felt very socially awkward. In school, growing up, in college, as an adult. I never really had the opportunity to learn appropriate social cues because I was never really allowed to be around people my age. Hence, because I was always expected to take care of my parents from Age 4 on, I never had the opportunity to learn what it's like to develop properly and learn normal social cues. So I've been stunted , so to speak in my social growth in so many ways and now that I've been invited to a social Gathering that is upcoming in August, I feel I've already made several faux pas, and the one that I made today is freaking me out and causing me to want to binge or at least overeat. I know that the first two probably weren't that big of a deal because it has to do with the dinner that is going to be part of the shindig. I simply told the hostess two types of food that I don't eat. I didn't get into the why. I didn't feel that was necessary. I'll mention it here just to show my reasoning on the matter. I used to eat one of these food groups until I developed my eating disorder but I was really picky on it and then once I had my eating disorder I stopped eating it completely. I had stopped eating it for so long that when I tried to eat it again, it made me sick. I thought it may have been a one-time fluke and so I tried it a second time and it made me sick again so I simply tell people I do not eat that food group. The other food group I simply have never eaten because it makes me nauseous even to smell it. At any rate, I knew enough of social cues not to need to go into this and just simply told my hostess that I do not eat these two food groups. I was half joking half apologetic when I told her this and said I hate being so picky. Which is true. Because I am an extremely picky eater which really has nothing to do with my eating disorder. I always have been an extremely picky eater. I had someone joke one time that I have another mental disorder. Picky eating disorder! I liked it! It fits. But the social cue that I wonder that I may have stumbled over today and that I keep on ruminating about and is driving me absolutely bonkers is that she had invited me over as well to watch a religious program that comes out every month for us and when I watch it at home, in order for me to be able to concentrate on it I have to do something else at the same time like crocheting or exercising or both or some active activity. I was worried that if I just went over there and sat and watched it I would get nothing out of it. I know she's pretty much the same way so I asked her today if she minded when I came in August if I brought my crochet stuff. She seems kind of hesitant which makes me wonder if I went too far by asking. She qualified it by saying she didn't care but she wondered about the kids getting into it because she has a two and a five year old. I don't see an issue with them and it just makes me wonder if I just am being too obsessive and nitpicky or what. and the thing that's bothering me the most is that I'm wanting to turn to food to get through this stressful moment. And at the same time, I'm actually wanting to restrict because warning- gross-out moment- my stomach is really giving me problems because I am majorly constipated. So even though for the most part, I've been having really good days with absolutely awesome moods and I think my psych meds are finally where they need to be, there's a little hiccup today which is making things a little bit more aggravating. Any advice or suggestions on the social cues would be helpful.
column9: For precaution, we just wanted to post some signs and symptoms to look out for.A person does not have to be underweight to have an eating disorder or to require emergency medical care for one. Seek medical help immediately if you:• accidentally or deliberately cause yourself a physical injury• become suicidal• experience confused thinking or are not making any sense• experience delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• feel disoriented; don’t know what day it is, where you are or who you are• vomit several times a day or have uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experience dizziness or fainting spells• feel too weak to walk or collapse• experience painful muscle spasms• complain of chest pain or have trouble breathing• observe blood in your bowel movements, urine or vomit• have a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• have an irregular heart beat or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• have cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or have a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr for any other serious medical concerns.If you experience any of the above, we highly recommend you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911. Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipation

column5: Hi friends,I just want to say how thankful I am for the Hope that I have.  That Hope is my faith.  That no matter what I am going through, even if I get depressed because of the trials, and need to get extra support, that I know I am going to be okay.  I am thankful that my  Mom is okay.  But what if she wasn't?  I know that even then I know I would be okay.  How some of you may ask?  Because I know that my stability doesn't come from my parent's or anyone else, but in my Lord.  I have faced many difficult and painful things.  I continue to as many of you do.  We will continue to until we die ourselves.  Just because I call myself a Christian, I am not promised as some of you may have heard the term, a rose garden.  In fact, I am promised that I will go through difficult times, tribulations, pain and suffering, loss.  But to not fear and to trust, and to know that Jesus will help me through these times.  In the past I didn't have the ability to put into action what I believed to be true.  I am learning more and am getting stronger as I heal and press into Him.   I am glad to be alive.  I am glad that I want to live.  I never did.  I always wanted to die.  I was afraid of everything.  I am thankful for the growth I have experienced this past year.  That my roots are growing deeper into trusting and believing.  I had a scare this week with the thought that I could have lost my Mom-my friend.  I don't know what tomorrow holds, except that I know I will be okay.  Not without pain and sorrow, but okay.I have enjoyed sharing my journey with you.  To see the hard work you put into the process of healing and recovery.  Growing through the slips and setbacks.  Sharing with each other your dreams and fears.   The struggles and the triumphs.   We all have a story.  Each and every one of us. We get to be involved in writing part of the story.  That is a good thing.  I am so proud of you guys/gals.  I am honored to be a part of this "family".  Thank you for sharing and please, don't ever give up hope.  Recovery IS possible.iwanttolive and I am
column9:
We just want to post some resources in case you or someone on the forum wants to reach out to speak with someone about any concerning thoughts or feelings.
Please take care!

column5: "In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, Lord, make me dwell in safety." Psalm 4:8.I have been reflecting on this a lot this week as I go through Psalms- how we try to seek safety and security in so many things that don't really provide the peace we are looking for. I know for me I have tried to create a sense of security in only eating certain foods/restricting, getting to a certain weight/my body looking a certain way, trying to seek re-assurance and certainty from my boyfriend/in my relationships, filling my schedule with more things/trying to stay busy and engage in meaningful work.But at the end of the day, clinging onto all of these things are just attempts to shield myself from painful emotions and intense fear- and it is only until I am willing to stop turning to my eating disorder or other forms of escape- and am willing to face the sadness and anxiety and pain as they come- that there can be growth and healing.It's been powerful to think about-- how ED might feel safe to us because it's all we've known for so long but it's really only an illusion. It may be temporarily numbing the pain but is really only delaying the process of feeling it. Only in the Lord do we have complete safety- there is refuge in His unchanging, unfailing love. I hope that everyone can feel courageous in taking one step away from clinging to ED and into trusting that they can surrender even in the midst of fear this week <3

column5: Last year I started my recovery from anorexia and orthorexia and I could tell that I was healing with everyday. I was not afraid of food I ate and do not categorised food anymore. After sometime I started to have episodes when I eat lots of food in one sitting. That food contained lots of sugars due to the reason I was restricting everything that was sweet in the past. These binging episodes repeated about 4 months almost every week. I don't remember actually how I stopped to do that but for almost 7 months I do not have those urges to sit and eat everything around me. I was eating reguraly but I was scared If i puted some extra bites in my mouth. So I also wasn't happy with my relationship with food. I use physical activities to maintain my weight and was feeling guilty everytime I  missed gym session. Almost four months ago I started to prepare for my final exams and my binges comeback. Whenever I started to learn these urges hit me and I was feeling guilty afterwards. My weight is normal, I still exercise, but now I started to do that i really like it and listen to my body more. I believe in moderation and let myself to have some treats daily, my calorie intake is quite high but I still binge every weak. At first i thought binges are caused by stress but exam session is over long ago and I still eating compulsive repeatedly. As I said, I binge every week for 4 months and I'm afraid that it becomes a habbit. Maybe someone has the same experience?
column9: Hi, Mmarij! Thank you for posting. We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forum. When you get the chance, please let a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you need any resources, you can reach out to the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. You can also chat during these hours by clicking chat now at the top right hand corner.

column5: It’s been a rough day from when it first started. I thought it was kind of weird that the surgeons office didn’t confirm my appointment, so I called when I got up to make sure, and they said I wasn’t on the schedule. That whoever made my appointment didn’t save it or something. So now I go next Monday. My mom told me after that appointment, we’re going to see my grandpa out of town again. I told her my therapist thinks I shouldn’t go again, because I didn’t cope well last time and almost caused a mental breakdown. (I didn’t bring up the substance abuse though). She said she won’t go without me. She won’t leave me at the house by myself while they’re on the trip. I told her I won’t let her blame me for not going. I’m a grown woman, I haven’t had thoughts of harming myself in a long time, my therapists think I’m stable enough at home to stay here alone. It caused this big argument. She went on to say how can I stay here alone when I do nothing. She went on to list all the ways I’m lazy and “don’t do *curse*”. So that made me feel pretty bad about myself. I guess that solid fortress of knowing my worth isn’t as solid as I thought.  I know I shouldn’t let her get to me but it did. She made me feel like I’m just lazy and weak for not being able to function with the pain and fatigue. “Everyone gets tired” “everyone has pain”. Like yeah, I’m just going to get my jaw sawed off and put back together by a surgeon because I have a little bit of pain. But whatever, I’m just a wimp right?? I’m having terrible vertigo today from forgetting to take a medication last night. So I’m lying down trying to keep my head still. But maybe I’m just being lazy. Argh. I’m just feeling really down about things. I hate how ptsd makes little stressors seem like the end of the world. Just needed to get this off my chest. Trying to open up and not bottle things up and isolate.
column9:
Hi, tryingtobebrave. Since you mentioned some past concerning thoughts we just wanted to post up resources in case you need them in the future. 
Please take care!

column5:
Something I posted earlier about today, was my therapist and dietician suggesting I don’t go visit my grandfather again so soon because of how I was barely able to cope with it. Even with substance abuse making me out of it most of the time, and spending a lot of time at the hotel or driving around with my dad, it still took a big toll on my mental health when I came back.
So my mom has proceeded to tell me that they won’t go if I don’t, that she won’t leave me at the house alone. I don’t know if my dad will be able to get her to come around or not. But this is not the first time she’s done something like this. I’ve been the scapegoat of the family for a lot of situations, and I’m not going to play that part anymore. Rationally I know she’s afraid of losing her father, maybe it’s easier for her to use my as an excuse not to go than to have to see him in pain from his burns.
I also know he wouldn’t want me to jeopardize my mental health.
But I’m also worried my mom will tell my aunts that I’m the reason she didn’t go. They’re already upset with her for not having stayed longer last time. So then the rest of the family would end up alienating me and blaming me. See? Scapegoat. But I don’t want to lose the closeness with my extended family. I don’t want to deal with all the fallout that comes from being the scapegoat.
I know at the end of the day what matters is what I think of myself. The truth of the matter is, whether it’s my moms manipulation or not, I do feel so guilty for not going to see him again next week. Everyone says I’m strong and brave but that doesn’t feel remotely true right now. I feel like a coward. I feel weak. I feel like a worthless granddaughter who can’t be what he needs me to, after the love me showed me that I couldn’t receive from my own father. My heart is shattering into a million pieces. It could mean that the last time I saw him, will be the last time I ever get to. My mom will resent me for the rest of her life if he dies before she sees him again. But i will resent me too, if I don’t shut down entirely. I feel like a horrible person, with a weak, cowardly, stupid worthless mind. I feel like I’m drowning in my guilt and pain and trying to stay afloat. Honestly I’m embarrassed for looking for validation or support or encouragement. But if anyone after reading this believes I’m not a guilty horrible person for not being able to go, please say so.
column9:
Hi, tryingtobebrave. We're sorry to hear that you're having these concerning feelings. We just want to provide you with some resources in case you need to reach out: 
Please take care!

column5: Trigger warning: talking about underweight body Hi again. Sorry, I really like posting here - this place makes me feel understood and like I'm not alone. This is for everyone who's made it through the weight gain part of recovery and can or wants to give some helpful advice to someone currently undergoing the struggle. I have gained quite a lot of weight since the beginning of my recovery, but I'm not nearly there yet and still have some kilos to go. But I'm out of the "danger zone", so yay! I know this is good (great actually) and necessary, but it's also hard to deal with. Only 2 weeks ago I was really thin. I am always a bit startled when i touch my shoulders, for example, and suddenly there is flesh. I'm unable to look at or touch my face. And I'm terrified because I know that I'm not nearly there yet and there are going to be so many more changes and there'll come a day when my face will be even more filled out. I really don't know how to cope. I really want recovery and while I'm not enjoying it right now and am scared s**tless of the changes and not knowing at which weight I'll settle, what I'll look like, I want to push through and reach a healthy weight ( no matter what the evil voice in my head says) I hope that once I'm there, I'll be able to accept myself anyways. But getting there is not easy. How do or did you cope with the changes? With feeling utterly disgusting, like you're the ugliest person in the world, like you're huge? And how do you deal with no longer "feeling yourself", with parts of your body suddenly touching, there being flesh on you? Do you have any tips despite just sitting with it and waiting it out? Would love to talk to some of you. Thank you bee
column9: Hi, fightingbee. Parts of your post has been edited as detailed descriptions could be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you for understanding and please continue to post.

column5:
Sorry for posting so frequently, I just have a lot of things I need to talk about.
Lately my younger sister (11) has been talking about wanting to be a model. This in itself is extremely triggering and difficult to hear her talk about as I am aware of how in many cases models themselves struggle with their food relationships.
If I were in a better place with my recovery I feel that I would be able to handle this better but unfortunately I am not.
I've noticed a decline in her eating lately as well, which again, is extremely triggering as I have been struggling with getting all of my planned meals and snacks in as I need to get back to a healthy weight.
Even worse is the fact that my parents are aware of this and don't view it as a problem, in fact, the almost seem to be supporting it.
This is extremely damaging to my mental state as they too learned about the effect models can have on individuals with an eating disorder while I was in treatment, yet when I bring up my concerns to them they get angry with me and tell me that i'm overreacting or that i'm "Sick" and shouldn't even be talking to my sister.
I really don't want to go back to inpatient care but it seems like that may be the only way i'll truly get through this relapse. My home doesn't feel safe anymore and I feel like I have no where to go and nobody to talk to.
Does anyone have any tips on how I should deal with this? I'm not an adult yet so I can't leave or admit myself into a treatment facility. I'd like to stay home but if i'm going to do that i'll need some new coping strategies as the one's i've been using no longer work.
I am very afraid for not only myself but my younger sister to. She's so young and I just want her to live a good life without an eating disorder but I feel helpless.
column9:
Hi, BitterMeringue. We're sorry to hear about what's been going on. For precaution, we just want to post up some resources in case you need to speak with someone. 
Please take care!

column4: trials and an update on things happening
column5:
In recovery and living life, and for me, as a Christian; trials come and death comes and pain and confusion and mistreatment and being judged and ignored and told what to do...you get the point.  I have been dealing with so many emotions and anger and anxiety and depression.  Some of it is because I am not trusting God.  That He is with me, my sister and He knows all things.  Learning to trust and to feel but to not live in my feelings as I have been is a learning experience that really only happens when going through the valley of the shadow of death.  This could be a real death, or the death of a relationship, or of a dream, or of serious illness.  Of a valley of not being treated right.  Of not being heard. Of being made to look foolish, of always being challenged about a lot of things I say.  Feeling alone and lonely and the physical limitations I have because of the pain.  In all of this, and this has been especially pronounced this month, but a lot of it has been on going for years, I am still learning how to process my emotions, pain and seeing what happens when I don't bring things to God and hold onto resentment and anger.  Anger I believe a lot of times has roots stemming from fear.  And I know what to do with this fear.  But I have been allowing all these intense emotions dictate my mood.  I know better.  I know that I with God's help, am in control of my mood.  That the thoughts I think and the things I dwell on affect my mood.  God says whatever is lovely, of a good report, right, worthy of praise, think on these things-Philippians 4:8.  This is not easy to do when the emotions of negativity are swirling all around me.  But if and when I allow myself to dwell on the problems, allow the fear to grow, focus all day on what if my sister dies, how I am always being challenged, this does something.  It makes me more depressed and hopeless.  Then I started feeling like I really wanted to die.  But then I said that would really not be good for anybody.  What I need to do is stand on The Rock, stand firm in my faith, and trust.  Talk about how I am feeling instead of isolating.  Do the things that I know work and don't do the things that will cause me to fall deeper into the pit.  It has been an extremely difficult time and even though I have been feeling so desperate and like I want to give up, I have let go of the anger.  I am trying to trust God more.  I have felt a physical sense of relief from the anger after a good talk with my Mom.  I have not used behaviors.  I have not gone backwards in terms of my eating. But I did return to feelings of extreme anger and anxiety.  I did allow myself to isolate.  I did not do what I know will help.  But this learning process WILL make me stronger and will be al learning experience and will be used for good.  I will NOT give in to the voice that says, oh why not...go ahead and just do this a little, it will make you feel better.  NO it won't and it won't take away the circumstances and the emotional pain.  Standing firm, talking, opening up, reading my Bible, doing what it says to do.  This is the answer for me.  It doesn't mean I am not going to feel angry, or sad, or depressed or anxious, but it does mean it will not take me.  I don't have to be swallowed up in the hurricane.  I can make it through the storm.  I don't know if any or you read through all of this.  It was for me, but also for any of you who were able to read through all of this to know that life happens.  Life hurts.  But it doesn't have to dictate to us how we will respond, or act.  We get to choose that.  I get to choose that.  So, I choose life and iwanttolive and I will.  I am loved by One Who holds me close in the storm.
I hope this is an encouragement for someone.  Take care and God bless.
column9: Hi, iwanttolive. We're so sorry to hear about what's going on. Since you mentioned some concerning feelings, we just wanted to post up some resources in case you or anyone else on the forum needs them. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgSuicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlive: Call (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.orgDial Help Inc: Call (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or www.dialhelp.org Please take care!

column5:
I've recently decided to come here to get some help and feedback from people who have recovered/are recovering and have maybe gone through some of what I am currently experiencing.
I've had anorexia for almost 3 years now, I received serious treatment last year and was holding steady up until a few months ago. I've fallen back into my ways and am now down to hospitalization weight. I think i'll make my weigh in tomorrow and I truly do want to eat more to gain some of the weight back but I find that this time around i'm struggling badly with body image mainly concerning my stomach.
I'm aware that bloating happens and I can usually tell when that is the case, however i've also looked into weight redistribution and haven't found a solid answer. I'm very afraid that my stomach will begin to protrude and I will get a large tummy once I begin to eat enough to really gain weight. I'd be okay with this if I knew that it would redistribute evenly eventually.
I do work out (or at least usually do, I've decided to wean off for now) so I think that will help with the toning but I'm just not sure.
I want to love my body for how it's supposed to look.
I'm 14 years old.
Can anyone give me any tips or advice for dealing with this part of weight restoration?
Does anyone have any facts that could help to ease my mind?
I really fear a re-lapse as the city in which I live is terrible when it comes to health care and I nearly died the last time they threw me in the Psychiatric unit. If I don't get back to a healthy weight they will send me back to the unit and I genuinely fear what the outcome will be.
I no longer have the support of my parents, they assured me that they will no longer support or help me with my recovery anymore.
Some facts and tips on recovery and how to deal with it would be extremely helpful right now.
Thank you.
column9: Dear BitterMeringue, welcome to the forums! We would like to let you know that we edited your post to remove mentions of weight numbers, which is not allowed on the forums. You can review our community guidelines here. Thanks for your understanding and please continue posting!

column4: Will try to make this my last negative post
column5: I'm sorry for all the negativity in my posts lately. Were on the road, almost home. This trip really messed me up emotionally. I barely spent an hour with my grandfather the whole time because it was too much watching him suffer from the pain due to his burns. I abused my anxiety medication the first day, I was able to have compassion for myself about that. Then I felt worse later. I hate that I barely spent time with my grandfather. That it was so hard a shameful part of me wishes I hadn't gone and maybe wont next time. I'm a grown woman and can stay at the house by myself while they're gone. But everything I do is for my grandpa. And saying goodbye this morning tore my apart. I just want to lay in my bed and cry when i get home and watch TV under my weighted blanket. I know there's probably a lot of cognitive distortions in things like shame and guilt and hating myself. It's just my feelings. I'm sorry for being so negative here recently.
column9: Hi, tryingtobebrave. We're sorry about what's been going on lately. We just wanted to let you know that we edited out parts of your post as it described certain actitivies that aren't appropriate for the forums. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We apologize and thank you for continuing to use the forums.

column5:
Today was been horrible. There’s a few things that just escalated my feelings until I had a melt down. First, my grandpas house is so hot that it even bothers him, it’s almost not safe despite the numerous fans. I hope they take him to my aunts house or get a portable air conditioner which they were working on doing.
My mom has been acting weird too which stresses me out badly despite it being a normal reaction, her being sick over upsettting situations or stress or whatever is a huge trigger to my ptsd. One of the worst, that has me hiding in a fetal ball of closet. It’s not her reaction or even her. It’s just a background thing that happened during a trauma, and it’s the insignificant detail my brain picked up on.
And the worst part of all is I went to Colorado since it was only 30 minutes away with my dad and we got high together. It’s not part of my opioid addiction, but it still feels wrong especially with everything else. It was legal but it still felt wrong because someone in recovery. I will say that it had a huge impact on my pain, that was literally the first time in years that I wasn’t in pain.
But I lies to my mom about it, they were all in that hot house during that time my dad and I were away, I feel like I should have been helping my grandpa more but there wasn’t the type of things I could do that I didn’t already yesterday. He just needs a lot of rest more than anything to heal his body. And yeah, it’s hard for me to be around him in pain and so weak like that. He’s he person I love most, and beyond praying, there’s nothing I can do to take it away. It’s excrucating. And being around my mom ina bad mood and possibly sick made it worse.
So now, we just shared a meal all together then my dad took my back to my hotel room for the rest of the day, to get out of heat, and away from my mom being a trigger even though the fear has nothing to actually do with her. I hate ptsd.
And I hate myself. I know I was going to try to be easy on myself but I feel like I’ve been worthless and shameful this entire trip. My mental weaknesses have kept me from being a better granddaughter or even a better human being in general. I just want to go home tomorrow like we’re going to in the afternoon and hide in my bed. I feel so dark. I do have my last appointment with eating disorder therapist and dietician Thursday so at least I’ll be leaving the house to get out once.
I’m sorry I post so much. And I’m sorry I’ve been negative.
column9: Hi, tryingtobebrave. We're so sorry to hear about what's going on. Since you mentioned some concerning feelings, we just wanted to post up some resources in case you or anyone else on the forum needs them. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgSuicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlive: Call (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.orgDial Help Inc: Call (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or www.dialhelp.org Please take care!

column4: Not coping well with trip so far
column5:
Today was day one of two, then Wednesday we come back. My mom was frantic and stressed and worried, which compounded my own anxiety and I wasn’t able to get space from it for a while, so I took too much of my anxiety medication. I didn’t have eating disorder behaviors or give into urges to exercise, but I did abuse my anxiety medication by taking too much to numb my panic thoroughly. Then I slept for several hours and my grandpas house until he came home. I’m glad I was sedated honestly and I feel ashamed for this but I almost crumpled at the sight of him. He looks so fragile and broken. Not to mention, that I’m sure it was traumatizing for him. So now I’m back at the hotel, resting. They only had separate rooms without the connecting door this time which is a relief because I feel like I can breathe and not be stressed by my moms stress. Being around her when she’s worried or upset while we’re traveling is a huge ptsd trigger. And another thing I’m ashamed of, is I snuck an extra anxiety pill for tomorrow so I can one extra than my prescription allows to get through the day and sleep. I feel like a horrible worthless piece of garbage right now. I have so many negative things swirling through my mind.
The two positives are i can tell my aunts really love me and care about me because they ask me questions about my struggles, and knowing how hard this is for me right now. I wanted to cry at their kindness. I know they love me. And seeing my Papa, despite the state he is in, calmed the storm inside of me for a while. And my mom does try to help me get through this the best she can, like she told me it’s okay for me to go back to the hotel earlier so I can relax. So I feel even worse for lying to her about taking extra anxiety medication behind her back when she’s kind to me about this. I’m just in a dark spot and feel really lost. Need some support or encouragement. Just to know I’m not alone really, because I feel like I’m drowning.
column9: Hi, tryingtobebrave. We're so sorry to hear about what's going on. For precaution, we just wanted to post up some resources in case you or anyone else on the forum needs them. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgSuicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlive: Call (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.orgDial Help Inc: Call (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or www.dialhelp.org Please take care!

column5: So I feel like I’m going backwards. I just finished school so I have a lot more time on my hands. I have a lot of stress and my second family is in another state for two weeks. They are like my mom and dad. Most supportive. I think everything is crashing down. I have a physical for a new job so freaking out about stepping on the scale. At the doctor they weigh me backwards. This is a different clinic and I can’t go into my health issues or it could affect my job potential. I’m struggling and pushing myself to eat but nothing sounds good and my focus is switching to weight and calories. I’m so angry with myself because I don’t want to go backwards again. So frustrating.
column9: Dear amattox, we would like to let you know that we slightly edited your post to remove the medication name, which is not allowed on the forums. Thanks for your understanding and please continue posting!

column5: First post and it's unfortunately because of a tough situation. I'm a binger with episodes of starving, haven't had too many episodes in the past few years and I'm in therapy. Been working on my relationship with food intensely. Anyway I have a friend's wedding coming up. Bridesmaid dress came in and it didn't fit and I blame myself so much even though the store confirmed the model I tried on had gotten stretched.... I'm just really upset and I'm really having a lot of urges to relapse/punish myself/etc again. I've been going to the gym lately (that was a whole hurdle for me considering my past with extreme diets/workouts, but I'm primarily going for physical therapy reasons) and it's so tempting to use the gym to punish myself. Anyway yeah that's it, I'm just struggling and can't talk to my friends about it.

column5: I've been in recovery from my eating disorder for a couple years and haven't really gotten all the way there.  I found out I was pregnant back in April and I'm having a really difficult time with it.  It's not about the body image surprisingly but about how much I have to eat.  I'm trying to eat intuitively but after 10 years of anorexic behaviors, my cues are all messed up.  It's like a car.  In a normal car, you get an oil light, notifying you that you need to change the oil in your car before your engine burns.  But in my car, there is no oil light.  I don't acknowledge that it's time to eat until it's too late and I'm experiencing light headedness and hunger pains.  My partner has been really encouraging but I'm starting to have major panic attacks about it because I want my child to be healthy but my brain only acknowledges full and starving.  I don't know what just plain hungry feels like.  I tried to put myself on a schedule so that I'm eating something every three hours but I just can't keep up with that without daily panic attacks about eating when I'm "not hungry".  Help.
column9: Hi, littlemermaid19! Thank you for posting and congrats! We’re sorry that you’re struggling right now but we hope that you find the support you deserve here on the forums. When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. You mentioned some concerning symptoms so we are just posting this list. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience anything on here, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column4: New to forum, not new to eating disorders. Looking for therapist
column5: Hi! I am semi-recovered from eating disorders (ED brain is very active atm tho behaviors aren't following yet). I am looking to reenter therapy after a long absence.My issue is that I work best with a male therapist, and there don't seem to be that many out there. The few male psychologists don't seem to have any eating disorder experience. It's frustrating.Does anyone else have this issue? I am female and older, had periods of active ED for the last 30 years. I've done inpatient and IOP in the past and I certainly don't need that extent of treatment, but just a knowledgeable professional to help me work thru the issues that are driving this.Thanks for any/all input!

column5:
Lately, I have been struggling a lot with my PTSD and chronic pain. Both of these things cause feelings of hopelessness in me at times. I’ve been having to be more vigilant in order to not dive back into substance abuse in order to cope with these things. I’ve had a few urges to use behaviors at times. When these things occur, it makes me question if things will ever “really get better”. I bet I’m not alone on the forum in having that thought.
But here’s the thing: that’s a cognitive distortion. When I go back and examine the evidence, I can see so much progress from where I was this time last year in treatment. I would never be able to deal with a triggering event that I’ll be handling next month without using eating disorder behaviors or substance use. I would never have been able to identify my distorted thoughts and come up with a counter thought. And though it doesn’t take away the feeling and symptoms of my PTSD, I learned in trauma therapy what is physically going on in my brain. I can say it aloud to myself as it’s occurring and though it doesn’t change what’s happening, it helps me realize my brain will calm back down in time (sometimes). Yes, I still go through depression and dark moods but I use healthy coping mechanisms rather than addictions and harmful behaviors. I used to have a habit of constantly justifying every thought or action I made, because a core belief I used to have was that I had to justify my existence. I had to prove to others that I wasn’t a waste of space. But that was never true. And I no longer justify myself to others. I still have the urge to at times but I recognize it and use healthy thinking instead. The end result of it being that I don’t hate myself most of the time. I’m actually starting to like parts of who I am. I’m becoming more confident in who I am and I never thought that was possible. I never thought I could recover but I am. Sometimes in the midst of our struggles, we lose perspective on how far we have come. And I will keep telling myself that just because I’m going through a very difficult thing, it does not erase all the growth I’ve made.
Just today, I resisted the urge to justify to my mom that my pain reached a point where I had to go back to bed. I let her say her judgement, and didn’t take it personally. I do what I have to, to cope with where I’m at. It’s enough. It has to be, because I am doing my best.
I just wanted to give an update and hopefully share some hope I experienced today.

We're just going to post up some resources in case you or anyone else on the forum needs them.Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgNational Suicide Prevention Lifeline: (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlive: Call (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.org Dial Help Inc: Call (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or www.dialhelp.org Please take care!

column5: 11 years...it's been 11 years since I would consider myself "recovered" from my anorexia...but I'm starting to realize that there are sticking points to my experience with that that have held on since. I feel like I've been on an on and off diet since I was in 8th grade, always trying to be in control of my weight since I was a little heaver. Went through my ED, came out on top (by the grace of God! and I'm so grateful), but have been fluctuating with my weight ever since. I'm in this constant state of thinking about food..."when will I eat next?" "What will I eat next" "I need to eat healthy" "I need to eat less" "I need to exercise so I can eat what I want" "Am I even hungry?" "I'm not hungry, but that sounds delicious, I'll have some"I get anxious when I think about my routine gets messed up and I don't know when I will be able to eat next, I get anxious thinking about WHAT I will eat because I don't feel great that day about how I look, my days revolve around food. Not specifically unhealthy food, not specifically anything, but food in general. I could be counting down the minutes until I could eat an apple. Why...after 11 years can I eat the things that I couldn't during my ED, but still be obsessed with when I will eat next? I'm way past the overcompensating for starvation, and my family who loves food too just says "we're foodies, we love food!" Is it just that I find food enjoyable or is it a true "obsession"?

column5: I just realized I haven't been on here for two weeks... I thought it had only been 1. I got my wisdom teeth out a week ago, and apparently had already been inactive before that. Well hi again everybody. I skimmed through posts but didn't read them all sorry - Hope everyone is doing ok <3I was concerned my wisdom teeth surgery would be very triggering due to the inability to eat as well as to potential for swelling (right before surgery I started getting insecure about how round my face is and was sure that swelling would worsen that insecurity). But I'm actually doing ok, at least in terms of the eating disorder.I definitely wasn't eating a lot right after surgery, and there was orthorexia problems I am now remembering. But it wasn't That Bad. I did get very depressed for a couple days. I don't know how I'm allowed to talk about this, but in a text to my therapist I said "I was the highest on the 'danger-to-self' scale I can remember being." I think I was reacting to the medicine I was given. I was miserable... But not in an eating disorder way so that's good? It's possible the reason food has seemed so easy is because I was undereating but not yet in starvation, so my eating disorder instinct was happy and I wasn't yet suffering the negative consequences... We'll see if things continue to be easy as I return to normal eating. I have been rather hungry so I'll try my best to eat as much as I want. Yesterday I was craving a [treat]. I wasn't able to get it, but I got it today!! The eating disorder thoughts are shockingly manageable. More like what I'm expecting to be afraid of than actually being afraid. There's a little bit of anxiety but very quiet. I was so grumpy this morning but feeling better now. I will try my best not to restrict at all, just to reinforce this lack of fear.Less good is that my mom is on some sort of diet... Hoping she doesn't become too obsessive. I have never known her to diet before. It's not a weight thing, but has orthorexia leanings that are a bit worrying.

I eat every 2-3 hours and every day I go from intense hunger to intense fullness. How am I supposed to eat every day? I’ve tried intuitive eating but I don’t know if I’m hungry of full. I just want to enjoy life and food without feeling so extreme. I feel like after coming so far I’m dead in the water in terms of progress and I’m unceasingly gaining weight I’m uncomfortable with. I know every body and every recovery is different but how do you eat normally?!

column5: Hello Braveheart,  how have you been?  How is your grandfather doing?  How is your heart?  Thank you for your support.  I am doing okay.  Scared.  But trying to trust Jesus.  It is interesting because I finally came to the point where God got me to understand that I will be okay when my parent's die.  Then not even two weeks later my sister gets so sick.  But I know the tactics of the enemy and he won't win.  I know how much you have been hurting but know that Jesus will always be there by your side.  I hope you are doing okay. column5: I suffered from an eating disorder (EDNOS as it was classified at the time - now would be OSFED atypical anorexia), though I didn't know it until I was undergoing treatment for depression in my early 20s.  I began restricting when I was 12 and the summer that I turned 14 I had only eaten something on 10 days out of the 10 week summer term.  In my later teens a couple of my boyfriends helped me to start eating more normally, but the urge to stop has always been there, and if I'm stressed it gets worse.  For a few years, though, I've very seldom had the urge at all, but then it came back with a vengeance a few weeks ago.Unfortunately, a few days after the urge had returned, I was travelling with a colleague on business and the chef in the hotel we stayed in was off so we couldn't get breakfast before leaving the hotel.  We got stuck in traffic going to our morning meeting so didn't get a chance before it, and while we were in it my colleague received a message to say that he needed to be home by 2pm (personal reasons), so we came out of the meeting and drove straight back without stopping.  As a result, I'd missed both breakfast and lunch, and missing two meals has always been a trigger for me ('I've done this much, I can just keep going'), even without already feeling the urge to skip meals.That was the 10th of May and ever since then I've been battling the urge to stop eating.  I've lost weight since then - that in itself isn't a bad thing because I'm certainly not thin (genuinely not - that's not my ED talking), but it's a bad thing in as much as it hasn't been done sensibly.  I always track my eating but usually have it set to around X calories and stay within that; this last month what I've done instead is set it to X and try to stay *above* that.  I know X isn't enough but it's better than nothing and gives me something to aim for.  If my husband sees I'm not eating then he'll cook me something because he knows I won't waste something he's cooked, so that's helped me stay over that.Last week I was feeling a bit more in control, so I was able to increase my intake. I'm really worried about next week, though - I'll eat pretty normally over the weekend because it's my birthday and I'm going to be surrounded by friends at mealtimes, but next week my husband is going to be away helping his parents move house.  I know I'm going to find it difficult to handle the weekend's eating anyway (it won't be excessive but it'll feel like it after a month of restricted eating), so my husband would usually probably have ended up stepping in somewhere in the first half of next week.  With him away until the following weekend, I don't know what I can do to try and ensure I don't stop eating.  I know a week isn't going to kill me, but I'd rather avoid it if I can.Does anyone have any suggestions?  What do you do to keep yourself on the right path?Thanks

column5: I am sorry but this is not going to be nice.  I am so angry with my roommate right now.  After telling her how violently ill my sister was today due to doctor negligence and not reading her CT scan until 26 hours later, he made her so sick.  I arrived at church and called her and heard her crying and immediately picked up my things and sped off to the .  Speaking about this to my roommate she was so stupid in her response, WELLLLLLL the doctorrrrrrsssss  know what they are doing.  Your Mom has been there and knows what is going on and even said that she was getting good care.  I said that was two days ago and this never should have happened today.  The doctor should have been there.  She said, wellllllll, it is the weekend and blah blah blah.  I am so angry.  I told her you have no idea what you are talking about.  My sister should never have suffered the way she did and you have no idea of what you are saying. I wanted to really scream at her and her  comments. I did raise my voice which is not something I do with her but come on, really!!!As for the support given to me, thank you.  My sister is doing better now and will receive nutrition through her port for now.   I know that eating one and a half bags of what ever in one week isn't ruining my recovery.  I just don't want to have "it" come back and that is not referring to ET for all of you who are old enough to know the movie!!!  I am myself concerned that I have C-diff.  I will  find out tomorrow but I have had the runs for a month.  It makes working difficult.  I feel like a wet noodle.  There is no reason for this.  I am not eating anything different nor taking any new meds.  I am just so sad.  My sister so weak.  My parent's did get a chance to get out for the day but it was overshadowed by my mother worrying about my sister.  I don't want to go to work tomorrow but it is probably the best thing for me and until I know the reason for the diarrhea I can go unless I find out I am contagious.  But I wear gloves when doing anything personal and wash my hands a lot.I am not overeating and will be seeing a intuitionist to help me improve on my quality of food choices.  I am sorry this is all over the place, that I am so angry and didn't respond to your reply's sooner.  I just wasn't up to it.  I appreciate your kindnesses.iwanttolive and I am
column9: We had to slightly edit your post to remove language that violates the community guidelines, as we want to maintain a safe, respectful environment. Thank you!
column13: The editing was for a phrase that included a specific action that falls under the category of our guideline to "Be true to yourself and be respectful of others." We apologize if the editing upset you, and we can contact you to further discuss it if you would like. We do not edit posts to make users feel in the wrong, but rather as a precationary measure for younger users, or users that may find something triggering or upsetting! We also make sure to not promote violence or unkindness. We hope you still continue to post, and are glad you are apart of the community!

column5: Hi.  I am writing for some support.  I spent the night in the emergency room the other night and had another episode of not being able to move my body at all except for initially being able to shake my head.  My ability to communicate verbally was there not so good at first and that too went for about six or seven hours.   I stayed in the observation part of the hospital and the next day I was unable to move my legs and hips.  This is due to a disorder I have dysautonomia.  There was also a medication interaction that caused this episode.  I had a similar episode in January.  It was very scary.  Trying all my might to move my body and not being able to.So today I continue to be weak and dizzy and don't feel well and I have to go for more tests and be put on a heart medication.  My blood pressure usually runs very low. My sister just had surgery today.  She has not been able to eat or drink for the better part of a month and before that it has been very painful and she hasn't really eaten much for several months.  Her brain has not been able to communicate with her body to allow her to swallow.  My Grandmother had that happen.  So today she had a permanent J tube put in her.  They had to operate and do extensive work to  put it in.  She was operated on for about two hours.  It has been difficult seeing someone I love suffer and get weaker and weaker.  It reminds me of when I was anorexic and refused to eat and as you all know it goes deeper than just refusing to eat.  There are fears and emotional problems that go along with anorexia that others who can not eat don't have.  She does have a lot of pain in her life.  I hurt for her and I have to learn not to take on her pain as I have always done all my life, the sponge.  It is a possibility that with her condition she could die.  We all have to face this reality and it is difficult.I am feeling depressed as I am not able to go out for walks and do things I usually do, haven't driven in over three weeks because  I am dizzy.   I manage to work four hours three days a week, but it is difficult.  My case is relatively easy so that is good.   I can come home and rest.  I am not always feeling so sick.  But the pain in my body prevents me from being able to go for long walks with my dog, and from cleaning without pain.  My heart hurts in three ways.  One for my sister.  One for real.  And one for the incapacity I have had to live with.  I know others are a lot worse off.  My sister has what I have and she rarely goes out and mostly stays in her bed.  I apologize for going on about this medical stuff.  I will be seeing a nutritionist who will help me reduce the amount of sugar I take in.  It is known that sugar can complicate pain in the body.  I have been doing so well in recovery I am nervous to change things up and be on a more strict eating plan.  I have basically been eating whatever I want and been maintaining my weight and being balanced in my approach, but I need to add in a food category which I do not find enjoyable and reduce the sugar.  I don't want it to get me off track.  Thank you for listening.  I am just feeling lonely and tired and not sleeping well and on and on and on.  So thank you.Her surgery went well and so far she is doing okay.iwanttolive and I am
column9: Hi, iwanttolive, we're sorry to hear about what's going on with your health complications and what your sister is going through. We hope everything goes well and please stay strong! Just because you mentioned some concerning symptoms we want to post up some signs and symptoms in case anyone else on the forum experiences them also as it seems like you are in touch with some medical professional help.The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit We recommend getting medical help as soon as possible when experiencing any of the above.  Please take care, iwanttolive!

column4: Still gaining weight after weight restoration
column5:
I had been suffering from anorexia for about a year and disorded eating for 4-5 years (lots of diets) and I finally decided to get some help last summer.
At first, I started gaining weight very fast even though I was eating normally, or maybe a little bit more than normal, but then again I was very underweight. After a tiny relapse where I restricted a bit, I suffered from extreme hunger and restored completely my weight through that process. I got my period back and the bingeing episodes completely stopped. I settled at a weight that is quite high (according to BMI it was in the "overweight" category) but I managed to stay calm about it, putting it on account of the overshoot. About five months ago, my therapist prescribed me antidepressants and I didn't notice any side-effects at first. However, I recently weighed myself and I have gained weight ! I didn't really noticed it at first because my clothing size didn't dramatically change, at most, I would say that my clothes might feel a bit more tight.
I also feel like my eating has gotten quit normal : I don't really have the urge to restrict anymore and I feel free to eat what I want, whenever I am hungry. I don't feel like I am overeating either, but then again I find it a bit hard to know exactly when to stop and I might eat just a bit more than necessary so that I don't get hungry quickly. I also do light exercise and more intensive sports.It really stresses me out and I feel like some ED thoughts are coming back because my treatment team thinks that I should pay more attention to what I am eating. The thing is that I was getting really satisfied with the freedom I had started to feel by allowing myself to respond to my hunger cues and not judge myself for what/how much I was eating. I don't want to go back to a place where I have to think too much about it.I don't know if someone has had any experience similar to mine or knows if the possible weight gain could be due to the antidepressants. Also, what is the best thing to do if the weight keeps piling on ? Should I start noticing and adapting my eating habits which might put me at risk of adopting some unhealthy behaviors again, or wait until my body decides it no longer needs to store fat ?
column9: Dear sophiaggs0, we would like to let you know that we edited your post to remove weight number, the name of the medication as well as detailed eating disorder behaviors, which are not allowed on the forums. You can review our community guidelines here. Thanks for your understanding and please continue posting!

column5: So, I've been writing about how terrified I've been to eat, because of how I'm then afraid of other behaviors happening.  I'm rightly scared for my life.  Today I couldn't eat breakfast but after feeling  light-headed again I thought I better eat something . So I had a small snack which terrified me but I knew I needed to. I really wasn't planning on eating anything else today when I was going in the afternoon to various errands I need to run I honestly felt like I was going to black out and that terrified me even more. I don't want to put others at risk while I'm driving and yet I'm still terrified because of so much that's going on in my head. I was afraid that if I went home to eat I would end up feeling like I would binge so I decided to go to a restaurant. That's where I am right now and I'm staring at my food and feeling terrified for my life. I've never been this bad to the point where I really thought I would pass out. It's scary and it's also still scary to eat.I know it's not because of fear of gaining weight.  I'm not thrilled with my weight but I've kind of become accustomed to it. It's more of a fear of feeling like I will then resort to other behaviors that are not beneficial. I'm really tired of the struggle and I'm glad that I'm seeing my eating disorder therapist this afternoon.
column9: Hi alwaysthinking,You mentioned some concerning signs and symptoms. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention: • accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury • become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense • delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there) • disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are • vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses • painful muscle spasms • complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing • blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit  It sounds like you have described some symptoms of a medical emergency. It is important that you seek medical attention immediately and let them know about your eating concerns. Please contact a medical professional you are currently in touch  or another option is calling 911.

column5: So I ate lunch right now, but noticed I started counting calories again and now I want to go walking to make up for being weak and giving in to food.  I hate this THING inside me that wants to kill me, yet I've started going back.  I could really use some encouragement right now.  I feel very alone in the disorder, as though I'm fighting alone.

column5: feeling awful I posted no responses so just posting again..my daycare was basically told we are going to fail accredidation even though we are all working so hard...it has just been a bad week then today my therapist cancelled she might be able to do a phone session tomorrow but I am just crying because I want to see her. I have no motivation to eat and no desire and don't want to do anything. I am just so hurt I already feel like a failure when it comes to my job but now I feel I am failing more since the woman who made the judgement came in my classroom. it sucks to feel like you are failing yes I am miserable at my job but it doesn't mean I haven't been still working hard. I just can't I feel hopeless.

We have slightly edited your post to remove the mentions of behaviors that may be triggering to others. You can review the community guidelines here. We encourage you to continue using the forum to seek support!

column5:
Hey!Does anybody have experiences/advices how to achieve full food freedom when having food intolerances?I assume that I got these food intolerances because I´ve consumed artificial sweeteners in quite large amounts for years. I´ve read that those compounds can alter the gut flora (therefore, I don´t consume artificial sweeteners since almost 3 years now). Has anybody made similar experiences? I am in recovery from restrictive eating for almost 2 years now and managed to escape the binge-restrict cycle, constant food thoughts and healthy eating obsessions and I´m pretty relaxed around food nowadays. These days I just want to enjoy my regained relaxed relationship with food. The only thing that is holding me back from beeing completely stress-free around food is the fact, that I don´t tolerate certain foods.The problem is, when I eat normal amounts of certain food I get very bad flatulence some hours after the meal. When I eat these products yet multiple times in a day, the flatulences get so bad, that I can´t leave the house anymore because I have to fart constantly (sorry!!).
(Sidenote: I don´t have celiac disease and I don´t think that gluten is the problem. I rather assume that I don´t tolerate inulin (fructose-polymer), because it´s a component of all foods that I don´t tolerate. I observed the symptoms and experimented with eating this type of food for month). However, when beeing on the move or when eating out in a restaurant, I just want to have the convenience to buy/order "normal things". I just don´t want to think about food and what I can & cannot eat all the time anymore, like in my disordered eating times - I´m so sick and tired about it!When heading out for eating in a restaurant, I slightly get stressed out because I don´t know if there´s a dish for me to order. If possible, I want to check the menu in advance (just like in disordered eating times). And yet I just want to eat normal things and order the most delicious thing on the menu now that I don´t struggle with disordered eating anymore. Also, when my boyfriend is cooking, I also avoid to eat with him and cook something seperate for myself (just like in my past eating disorder days - it´s so exhausting!).Currently, I also do things like meal prepping, just because I really don´t want to eat unsavoury things all time I´m out and about and it´s the only thing to buy in a normal store that I tolerate and will make me full.Furthermore, I don´t actually want most other people to know that I don´t tolerate certain types of food, because it would be somehow embarassing to me.. Does anyone have a similar problem or any suggestions, how to obtain a relaxed relationship with food despite the intolerance, especially when eating outside or when travelling?Thank you and sorry my question got so long and sorry for my bad english (I hope you get my problem anyway)!P.S.: I also have lactose-intolerance, but that´s no problem for me because there are lactose-free versions of nearly eveything these days and in case I can use this lactase-capsules that help to digest the lactose.

column4: feeling like i am just losing the battle...
column5: Everything has just been such a mess this week. I talked to my doctor about the bill too and she said it was a mistake and her billing person should not have sent me a bill and she said I don't have to pay anything and not worry about it. She said I am a special case and she accepts whatever my insurance pays and does not make me pay any extra which I didn't even fully realizes she was doing so that is great because there is no way I could afford her otherwise and she is a specialist for eating disorders. so some ups but then work...always a downer we have been working so hard on our portfolio for accredidation and this woman came in and observed our daycare for like literally no time at all and told our office manager that we are going to fail because of our classrooms. like we are doing terribly and we will not pass...the language of our children is horrible it was everything we are just failing. it felt like we are not working hard enough when i know all the teachers i was with at this meeting work so hard and i work so hard no matter how miserable i am at my job i still work hard. I do as much as I can and I doubt myself on my own now I basically have someone saying it...it hurt and I was really struggling last night because I just felt like I must be doing something wrong if we are going to fail and one of the classrooms she came in was mine she was only there like 2 minutes but honestly all of us felt awful. I am never hungry but I felt I lost any hunger at all last night after that I already doubt my abilities at work. i am so stressed i still have stuff to do for the portfolio which we are trying to get done by June. There is just so much pressure. I am spent and I fight everyday with myself to eat enough to drink enough to do anything to fight my trauma issues and it feels so much like a losing battle some days.
