You can review the community guidelines here. We encourage you to continue posting, and hope that you find strenght through your bravery in being vocal about your difficulties.

column5: I am new here. I am trying to accept that I have an eating disorder and relapsed about two years ago. I've been getting help for anxiety but I believe the relapse in my anorexia is what caused my anxiety and later problems. I'm now getting back to a healthy eating plan. This has taken courage but I still struggle a lot with feeling hopeless about a lot of things, but mainly myself. Not sure why I go to the negative place. I've been scared to realize that the Eating Disorder was the primary problem, as I think I was in denial up until a month ago, despite changing my eating to more normal amounts. Here I am now.

column5:
Hi! I've been in recovery (fully committed recovery) since January this year, and I've been doing pretty well! I'm trying to listen to my hunger cues and eat intuitively.
But a habit I can't break is randomly snacking all day. Like, every time I open the fridge, I grab some food. Every time I open de pantry, I grab snacks.
I'm not worried about how many calories I'm eating extra because of this, but I know it's not a healthy way of eating.I'm trying to practise mindful eating, but I'm having such a hard time. I have this strange food obsession and when I get hungry or want to eat, I get into a haze where I can't think clearly anymore. I forget all the mindful practises and just eat. Especially breakfast is a problem for me, I love breakfast! But I always have to eat it on my own with no one around and I get so nervous when I eat breakfast. Also I always keep snacking after meals.I noticed that it's really the small foods I eat all the time, I think it's so that my family doesn't really notice it when I eat these.Is this binge eating? I've been doing this for years now and during recovery I tried to fight it but it just keeps on turning back.

column5: I feel like such a failure and a hypocrite. I just can't follow the same advice that I give everybody else. I can't be my own cheerleader. I know all the right things to do and anxiety is crippling me and making it impossible. I've already compensated a couple of ways and done entirely too much of what I'm not supposed to do. I truly feel like giving up. I've restricted like crazy both yesterday and today. I haven't even eaten yet today and really don't care if I ever eat again. Yes I've said that before and I just keep getting at my Breaking Point. I am hoping and praying that things will improve because I know that Jehovah God will never let me endure more than I can handle.  And yet it feels like I have nothing in me to be able to endure.  Frustrated and disgusted with myself. I feel like such a failure and yet I simply can't do anything about it right now. I'm always appreciative of the support I get here and yet right now I don't think I'm at a place to receive it and I know I'm not at a place to give it. I really just feel like giving up. I'm trying so hard to do the right things and right now it is impossible. I know I am repeating myself a lot and I'm sorry for that. I'm just so overwhelmed that I can't think straight. I don't know what to do anymore except for pray. I know prayer is my biggest coping mechanism and that Jehovah God is stronger than anything I could ever imagine. So I'm just hoping that he will give me what I need. Correction I know he'll give me what I need I just hope I can accept it.
column9: We're sorry that you're feeling this way, alwaysthinking. We just wanted to post up some resources in case you need them. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgNational Suicide Prevention Lifeline: (800) 273 - 8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlive: (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.orgDial Help INC: (906) 482 - 4357 or www.dialhelp.org Please take care.

column5: Hi all.  I am really excited as I am nearing my one year free of all behaviors.  June will be the one year mark.  I want to let all of you know that recovery is possible, even for those who have suffered for a long time, as I did.  There have been many stressful and painful days, both physically and emotionally.  I have a lot of stress at work recently and it will continue for another month or longer.  But then I have to get used to a new client and the loss of the one I am with now will hurt a lot.  I have been with her for two and a half years and we have grown very close and I also love there dog.  She loves me too and waits for me to come.  I have had to make difficult decisions, have had to deal with difficult circumstances, so although I no longer deal with behaviors, life goes on and with it there is pain.  But I have learned I do not need to turn to the behaviors to help cope with the pain.  I am able to call my Pastor, I can talk with my Mom or Dad but more my Mom, I talk with God, and a few good friends.  The one who moved away we seem to be losing touch more and more as she is busy with her life in the Poconos.  I write this to encourage all of you who feel this will never end.  It can.  It does.  For anyone who is willing to put the time, effort and work into fighting the eating disorder, victory can be yours as well.  Just never give up.  Never give up.  Each one of you is special and unique.  You are important and wanted.  God said so.  My best to all of you.iwanttolive and I am

column5: Well my mom yelled at my insurance company they messed up on stuff so the doctors bill thing is being dealt with . But still everything is a mess my computer crashed and my dads friend is trying to get my stuff off of it but is having a hard time. I am beyond freaking out I also had to buy a new computer... I am just so spent I feel sick physically and my coworker posted some thing about our boss saying she needs to eat healthy and drink more and rest I am like no one knows when I restrict or don’t drink enough. I am such a mess I have been over emotional and just at a breaking point I calmed a bit but still overwhelmed and worried about all my work on my computer that can be lost and I feel bloated and sick. I have my period which always triggers me I have been over it a lot in therapy but I still hate it. I feel weak and drained and I just don’t know. I want to call out tomorrow and just rest I used to care more but I am just done. Like stupid too my pants ripped today Lomé just every little thing... and I am just so sick o my job too and looking into going back to school but even that freaks me out.
column9: We're so sorry to hear about what you're going through. Just because you had mentioned some concerning symptoms we just wanted to post some signs and symptoms just in case.  The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention: • accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit Or any other serious medical concernsWe highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible if you experiece anything on this list. Another option is 911.

column5: I'm dealing with a lot of anxiety right now and it's crippling me. It's amazing how something so intangible can paralyze you and make things impossible to do that you either really want to do or feel obligated to do. I was supposed to go to my cousin's today to eat supper and then help her put tags on things for an upcoming yard sale and I was beyond terrified to go and feeling just so anxious that it didn't make any sense. I talked about it with my best friend and he said it was probably because the stuff that's for this yard sale that I am supposed to be helping price are things from my old house that just recently got sold. My mother recently went into the nursing home and has a legal guardian that is trying to run her life and unfortunately mine. She has been progressively getting rid of all of our stuff and we just had, or I should say she just had, an auction to get rid of all the rest of the things in order to pay for my parents care. I'm not too upset about not having these items because my apartment's too small for most of them. It's just the idea of my life being given away to Perfect Strangers. And so this is causing a great deal of anxiety and it's manifesting itself in the eating disorder as well. Just had a grazing session and feel very guilty about it even though I really didn't eat a gigantic amount it just was unplanned and not really time for a snack or a meal. So now I am seriously contemplating compensating in several ways and feeling guilty about that even though I haven't even done it. Just totally freaking out again and really sick of my life being so chaotic and out of control. I feel like it's a disaster Zone. I wish I could be as compassionate to myself as I am to others , but I just expect so much out of myself and imperfection is not acceptable. Of course I know it's impossible to be perfect and yet I can't stop expecting it because it was expected of me for so many years. Very frustrated and extremely anxious.

For more information on the community guidelines check here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Cheers

column5: Not happy in so many ways. My eating disorder is not happy with me because I ate lunch even though I was not wanting to. It really did not make me happy to eat but I was trying to remember all my values and reasons for needing to eat, so I ate. Also, I was very dizzy and lightheaded so I thought I must be dehydrated and need to be eating and drinking more. Of course Maleficent,as I call my eating disorder, isn't happy about that in any way shape or form. Not happy either because my stupid shoulder pain is still interfering with being able to do regular activities and then that makes me panic about not doing enough movement which makes me panic about what I've eaten. It's such a catch-22. It doesn't seem to matter what I do, I'm getting in trouble in some way shape or form. Mainly in my head I know, and unfortunately too much in my body now. I keep wondering if my eating disorder is what has caused so many of my physical problems. It's frustrating because I know I did not deserve any of this. I did not choose to have an eating disorder. I did not choose to have things done to me that caused me to get this eating disorder. I did not choose to do eating disorder behaviors. It's so unfair , and I know that this world is not fair, and it doesn't make it any easier. I don't really know what I'm trying to accomplish in this forum Topic at the moment. I'm just very unhappy and frustrated and tired of everything. It seems like every time I feel like I'm getting ahead and making progress, I back slide and either have insane anxiety because I haven't given into the eating disorder or I give in to the eating disorder in one way shape or form and having anxiety because of that. As I said such a catch-22 and I am not happy. Yesterday I was in a wonderful mood because I was able to do stuff with my friends and in the ministry. It's frustrating when the physical interferes and I'm not able to do that and I get unhappy and lonely and entirely too much in my head. If I've written something similar to this before , I'm sorry. I have so many of the same things going on and on in my head that I tend to forget what I've said to whom and when and all of that. Hope someone can relate and give me some encouragement. Right now really wanting to compensate because what I had for lunch.
column9:

If you are experiencing any of these signs we recommend that you seek medical help as soon as possible.

column4: Weight Gain: Bulimia Recovery & Stopping/Starting Exercise
column5: Hello, this is my first post. I have  suffered from bulimia for approx ten years. I finally decided to do something about it at the start of last year, coming to terms with the fact that there would be weight gain etc, however I fell off the wagon perhaps 6 months in, which I now realise was because I wasn't allowing myself to 'eat freely'  (everything I ate was still very healthy and perhaps not enough) and in frustration of being on the heavier side despite all my 'healthy eating intentions' reverted back to binging and purging with a 'whats the point' attitude. This time round I am 4 months into recovery, however the difference between now and last year, is last year I was eating really healthily, not realising the need to eat freely and to eat over X calories. Which I am now doing this year.However,  I only discovered in the last 2 weeks that exercise affects your recovery and have read to not do any at all- which I find quite disconcerting as I do circuit and weight training every week. My gym contract finishes this week and I don't plan to renew it and just to fully commit to recovery. I have spent 4 months eating freely (all different food groups, foods I originally saw as bad, until I am full and sometimes uncomfortably full), have had the joy of all the symptoms of bulimia and am the heaviest weight I have been, which I am praying is just from the water retention (I have overshot by quite a bit). My question is, how long shall I not do exercise and if I were to take up something like hot yoga would that still classify as exercise and affect my recovery? I would love anyone to share their own bulimia recovery month by month (I know everyone is different) but I feel like it would give me hope or things to work towards as right now I feel quite unsexy (which I presume will only get worse once I stop exercising!). Would it be safe to start exercising say by the end of February? How do you know when its ok to start again, especially when you have already over shot your weight. Any advice would be greatly appreciated!ps ideally looking for those who have had a bulimia history because I think I will be able to relate more to it, I hope that is ok to say :)

column5:
I'm new to this so I don't know what maybe a normal format for a post. I am hoping to get some support because there are no support groups near me that fit my needs. One of them is so cliquey that I don't feel like I fit in there which is not helpful in the eating disorder world.
Anyway right now I'm struggling. I've been dealing with the eating disorder for 2 years even though I've had Tendencies toward them 4 most of my life. It's directly caused from abuse in my family because my father literally told me how many calories to consume while abusing me. Prior to that he decided to mind control me by telling me if I started eating I wasn't allowed to stop or I'd be punished. I've come to realize that it didn't matter what I did I would be punished for it. This is just really hard right now because I blocked out the abuse for  30 years. I'm just now starting to know what happened and it's not easy to cope with all of this. I thought I had been doing better and my friends and other support people indicated that they thought I was making tremendous progress. I feel now though this past month all I've done is backslide because I'm either eating all the wrong foods and entirely too much of them in order to numb my hurt feelings or I am hardly eating anything at all. Today has been the worst with three flashbacks in the morning and I'm wondering if my visiting my mother in the nursing home has precipitated the re-emergence of the anorexic tendencies. Another thing with which I've been dealing is after my first inpatient stay I gained weight which probably was necessary even though I  was not thrilled with it. I was just beginning to get used to that weight and recently I've gained incredibly too much in too short of a Time because of being on a medication a couple of times. So now I'm freaking out and feeling out of control. I restricted today and decided that I needed to eat supper even though nothing appealed. I finally ate what most people in the non eating disorder world will call a light lunch. And then I just felt totally out of control and felt like I needed to self harm or compensate for it or just be completely stupid like I feel I am. I just can't understand what I'm doing wrong. It always feels like I'm doing something wrong. If anyone can commiserate or have any helpful advice feel free to respond. Thanks. feeling  defective as always
column9:
Welcome to the forums! We would like to let you know that we slightly edited your post to remove specific eating disorder behaviors and the name of a medication, which are not allowed on the forums. You can review our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelinesWe are concerned about your safety since you mentioned self-harm. Please stay safe!

column5:
I’m really not happy or proud of myself for this but I’ve been having more episodes of binging and purging. I don’t know if I’m numbing my grief or what. I go from feeling stable / numb to feeling sad and angry and that’s when I get impulsive and binge/ purge. I also am confused why my psychiatrist increased my antidepressant as yes my depression was worse but don’t I need to go through that to get over my grief?? I just want to feel it so I can not have to feel it anymore but that’s not the way it’s working out, and the sadness / anger is so overwhelming and sudden that I end up using behaviors anyway. I see my trauma therapist tomorrow then dietician and ED therapist Thursday. Also my cardiologist Wednesday who I will have to disclose that I’ve been binge / purging to as I’ve been having a lot of edema and he should probably know about it for my heart issues anyway. I’m embarrassed to have to say I’m using behaviors as I’ve not been exercising and am slightly overweight so why would he believe I have an ED when my weight is what it is. Also my mom ha started commenting that I don’t eat enough which affects my IBS but I eat my meal plan??? Yes I eat a liquid meal at lunch but because of my jaw issue which has been the case for months and she knows that. I guess I haven’t been eating my snack but I don’t think it’s a big deal?? Am in denial or something but I don’t think it’s hat bad. I just need to get the binge/ purging under control because I don’t want to go back to that. I want to stay in recovery. I wore a skirt today for the first time in years and I struggled with body image but I didn’t let the eating disorder shame me out of not wearing it. I made a step forward.
The thing that’s keeping me awake is my mom said she felt like she pulled a muscle in her chest the last couple days, my dad freaked and asked if she’s sure she wasn’t having a heart attack. She said no she’s had no heart issues and knows her body and that’s not what it is. But now I’m having obsessive thoughts that I’m going to wake up tomorrow and she will have had a heart attack in the night. I know it’s probably grief making this happen as the first thought that entered my mind was “I cannot lose her too, it will break me for good”. Anyway I’m sorry this was long, I needed to get it out so hopefully I can get some sleep.
Just looking for support.
column9: Hello iwanttolive, Just a friendly reminder that we are not to promote certain religions or give advice here on the forum.Thank you, and please continue posting!  - NEDA Moderators

column5:
Hello! I'm new here (literally just made an account 5 minutes ago) and honestly I don't know where to start with this.
I've had bulimia for 3 years now and I just accepted that it was a problem maybe 4 months ago. I always thought it was nothing, I just made myself sick sometimes. I thought I was insulting people with actually eating disorders to say what I'm going through was an eating disorder. But if you do it 4 times a day till you feel sick, if you sneak out of parties to use symptoms, if you suggest to hang out in restaurant that you know has a bathroom with a single toilet so you can be free to use symptoms after without the fear of someone coming in and overhearing it. Then I guess that's a big indication that yeah its a problem.
And I'm so scared? to tell someone? last time I tried telling my friend about it she told me that there's something wrong with me and then avoided me until I told her it wasn't a big deal and i did it only a few times because I was too full.
It sucks because I don't know why I'm doing it and its so hard to stop. I know its not going to make me any thinner and I know it's not good for me but I just can't stop. I don't even binge, I eat once/twice a day with barely any snacking and I still purge. It's so hard I tried to stop purging once and i broke down crying because my stomach felt so uncomfortable and I felt like a failure.
I don't know what to do, I don't know how to tell my parents they're going to be so disappointed at me. I'm attending Uni literally a 26 hour plane ride away from them. they're going to be so worried I don't want to cause them any stress.
I know this is the maintaining recovery forum but i don't know where else to post this. I've been feeling so down and stressed about myself today, finals isn't helping either. I feel disgusting and drained and I just don't know what to do to make it all better. I thought I could stop it by myself, just by pure willpower you know? but that's dumb, that's really dumb of course I cant.
Sorry if this is complete gibberish I just needed to let stuff out.
column9:

column5:
Hi,I am really struggling at the moment. I experienced the worst of my eating disorder when I was 17, when I first experienced my symptoms. It was caught early and I was diagnosed and began treatment when I was also 17. My first experience of recovery was positive, I actually enjoyed learning all of the food I could eat without feeling shame or worrying about my weight. However, I always made sure I was eating the same or less than my mum. She was like my guideline and it became my new rule that if I ate less than her, it wouldn't matter what I ate. It turned more into OCD, which I have also suffered with since I was 7. I have since completed my a levels, and am at university. I wouldn't say I have relapsed, but I am always trying to find ways to restrict, or find food groups to cut out due to 'health reasons'.. The problem is, I'm not exactly restricting, as I am still eating, however I still feel as though I am restricting because I'm never eating what I would consider 'normal food' but instead eating faddy foods. This means that I binge on foods that I do 'allow' myself, leading to me eating a lot of what I feel confident and justified wanting, which isn't always what I want to be eating. I'm following a vegan diet at the moment, but I'll have something else rather than just having what I want. I end up eating way more of the bad stuff than the more nutritious stuff. I also drink a lot of my calories, and feel as though I'm being restricted if I can't have a hot drink. Is this normal? Is there a way I can stop feeling like I'm restricting even when I'm not restricting? How can I stop comparing everything I eat to my mum?
Also I have no energy, everything seems like such a big effort. Will this stop if I gain more weight? (My BMI is currently healthy and stable)Thank you.
column9: Hello, welcome to the forums! We would like to let you know that we edited your post to remove the mention of specific foods, which is not allowed on the forums. You can review our guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you for your understanding and please continue posting!

column5:
My fiancee recently passed away, after suffering with an eating disorder for over 9 years.
I supported her the entire time. Was a shoulder to cry on or a support to discuss anxiety that hits when you get a new appointment.If you're feeling low and want someone normal to listen, not judge, understand and offer advice then feel free to message. Im in no way a trained professional!
But i bet they are the people you want to avoid when you feel certain urges? I'm just an average guy who wants to help in any way i can.
column9: Dear mytime.lk, we are very sorry for your loss. We would like to let you know that we have edited your post to remove the phone number. As per our guidelines, sharing contact information is not allowed on the forums. You can review our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you for your understanding and please keep sharing!

column5:
alrighty, so this is my first post on any kind of website like this, so I'll start with a little bit about myself. (TW- binge eating, orthorexia, anorexia, sexual assault)
I am an 18-year-old full-time college student getting my degree in psychology and nutrition. I grew up overweight, homeschooled, no siblings, I was a loner due to circumstance. I began college in spring 2017 and was bombarded with the reality of who I was physically compared to my peers. I was obese. halfway through age 16, after suffering for so many years hating my body in my childhood, I finally took hold of my weight problem that was caused by a trash diet and no psychical activity. for the first few months of the weight loss, I cut out junk food and began drinking a lot of water and eating more "healthy" food.
 in August of 2017, it was the first week of my fall semester, I had lost a significant amount of weight, I had CONFIDENCE for the genuine FIRST TIME in my entire life. unfortunately, life working in the shitty ways it does, put a bad person in my path and I was thus sexually assaulted at the end of that week. I was 16 and he was 21. I was lucky enough to have supportive parents and my best friend, all of which gave me the guidance and space I needed to heal. I did attempt to press charges, and I fought for 7 months to get my case even acknowledged. I was put on blast publicly on his popular youtube channel (which has now grown tremendously and is my worst nightmare), yet the police shut down my case in February of 2018 because "there wasn't enough evidence." wasn't enough evidence- even though the entire hour and a half long event was RECORDED, and then the assailant himself put out a "storytime" youtube video shaming ME.  irrelevant. now, during that fall semester, I had to stay active in my classes and in my college (which he attended), but the day the semester ended I was already packed up and ready to move 3 hours north to a new college and new home with my family. in spring 2018 I began at my new college, new life, new name, new body. my weight loss during those 7 months of fighting for my case was not too faltered. I continued my diet and began further restriction; I have fears of many many ingredients now. it took me a year after beginning my weight loss to lose the weight, and I've maintained that loss now for the last year. sounds like I did pretty well, looks like it too, but inside has been an absolute warzone for the last few months. after hitting my lowest weight last summer, I was in my stride, but as some of you may know, having a restricted diet can lead to developing binge eating, which is what has taken over my last half a year. I've gotten myself into a binge/starve cycle that is destroying my quality of life. I will "binge", sometimes in one sitting and sometimes for days. I know the word binge means different things for different people, however, to make up for those binges, I'll restrict and eat only "healthy". I cannot seem to stop doing this. it keeps happening. like as I'm typing right now, I'm thinking about what bad shit I want to eat even though I'm "skinny" right now because it's been a few days since I had a bad binge.
I want to elaborate on how extreme this is for me. I haven't eaten normally in almost a year, I'm either eating too much or too little. I KNOW WHAT IS RIGHT, once again I STUDY NUTRITION AND PSYCHOLOGY so I am VERY AWARE of what I'm doing to myself, and I KNOW how to stop it, but I CANT? I don't want to? I just don't know what my excuse is. it was right around the 1-year mark of my assault that my mental/emotional/physical/spiritual states turned extremely dark again. I've begun smoking since turning 18 this last October, it's a good oral fixation to avoid eating. I will starve, or eat very very little, very nutrient packed healthy food, and then binge on nasty food out of nowhere just as I get skinny again. by skinny, here's what I mean. with my weight loss and loose skin, I have horrible body dysmorphia. I can describe it like a phantom limb. when someone loses their arm, they still feel it, they still see it, they still identify with it, because the brain hasn't caught up to the body. I still feel fat, I still see fat, I still identify as fat. when I binge, it makes me retain water and of course whatever food is in me, so my weight increases. (i weigh myself religiously). on rare occasions, I do break the cycle for a week or two, and get myself down to a lower weight. this fluctuation on the scale is something I can feel psychically and see.
look, I know I've got issues, we all do, that's why we're here. I have been in counseling a few times in my life for other reasons, like the PTSD surrounding the assault, but I haven't gotten help for my definite ED. the lovely therapist I had in the months following my assault noticed I was at risk of developing an eating disorder, and now here I am over a year later and some of them are killing me slowly. I know what I'm doing, this weird yo-yo diet I'm putting my body through, of having to process nasty toxic food and then small amounts of ultra-healthy food on and off just aren't how someone should live.
see, as I say all of this here, if any soul has taken the time to listen to me, I hear the EDs both going off at once. one is telling me to binge, eat everything, another voice is telling me to starve because I haven't eaten yet today so why mess it all up--- with both of these voices going off, I, of course, have the one quiet, oh so quiet, rational voice. the voice I know is me. the one that is so shoved down and silenced inside of myself because so many different disorders want the spotlight in my life. my rational voice is telling me, yes it is true I haven't eaten, and it's true I shouldn't binge, and yes I should eat soon, and if I want bread what's stopping me- SILENCED- that voice just got silenced as I was typing from it because starving voice said what's stopping me is the scale. but, as that one says that, the binge brain is still just telling me that is what I should do. I am hungry, if I don't eat soon I won't eat at all, but if I do eat soon I might just keep eating all day, I don't know, I sort of know, and that's what has me scared- knowing that I don't know. am I crazy? I don't think so. I think I'm more normal than I know, but if I think that then do I really know? I don't know. Help. This is the end of my first post, I may end up making future ones, this may end up being very helpful for me, only time will tell. I know I will have to overcome this, no matter what situation I'm in, there's always a silver lining visible to me. I knew that I would come out of the assault as a different person, my life would be and has been forever changed. for the better? I can't say. I just want this shitty chapter of my life to close positively as the past shitty chapters have.

column4: I don't know what to eat
column5: I have been suffering from Bulimia for a couple of years now. I went to therapy and I stopped throwing up. I don't really need it anymore but my Problem is that I don't starve for anything except for a certain type of food. I don't know what I should eat because I don't know what I should go for and then I just eat tons of that certain type of food. I don't know what I can change about that because all I do is feel disgusting. Has anyone experienced the same?

column5: Hi,I am currently 20 years old, and was removed from my sophomore year of college to go through recovery at home. I have been home for about three months and am beyond uncomfortable. While my weight loss started as a result of injury and depression, I now am noticing how much body image played a role. As I weight restore, I feel more miserable in my body than ever. I am having terrible acid reflux, constipation, bloating and just about any other side effect from restoring weight. I cant look at myself in mirrors, i ccry myself to sleep because im so uncomfortable, and I just don't see how it gets better: i see no light at the end of the tunnel. I also keep being told from people how much "better" "stronger" i look, and im embarrassed about how terrible these compliments make my feel about myself. I a trying so hard to continue with restoration, but its painful to watch my body change. Seeking anything: motivation/comments/reminders why this is worth it :(
column8: I'm very sorry to hear how
column9: I'm very sorry to hear how hard you are struggling. What treatment team do you have in place (i.e. primary care doctor, psychologist, nutritionist, etc)? If you need any assistance in finding a treatment professional, please go to the treatment portion of our website: http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/find-treatmentDealing with the emotions and physical symptoms of recovery can be very overwhelming. Even if things seem hopeless sometimes, recovery is possible!Recovery can sometimes be a long process but it is achievable. I'm proud of you for talking about the difficulties. Our helpline is available if you need help getting some treatment referrals, or if you just want to talk to a live person: 800-931-2237.

column5: I’ve been yo-yoing in my recovery for the past weeks (since its start) and I really want to let go of the control, the calorie counting, etc. but I just don’t know how! Any tips on how to do this? Also, does anyone have any good vegetarian dinner ideas? I’ve been eating the same thing for a week :/

Our community guidelines can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Thank you and please continue to post!

column4: Fully Weight Restored - Metabolism still sluggish?
column5: HI all - I'm new to the forums, so it's nice to meet you all!I'm 23 and up until recently I've been a long-distance swimmer for the majority of my life. I swam through college and officially retired from the sport last year when I finished out my senior season and graduated. I struggled after freshman year and lost a significant amount of weight before my sophomore year which gradually continued through my junior year. Finally, I hit a point where I realized there was no way I could keep up with the amount of hours a day I was swimming while consistently underfueling like I was. I was threatened to be removed from the team temporarily on medical leave, but I was also named captain for my senior season. So that was my turning point for me. I was ready to embrace my final season whole-heartedly at my best and also put my best foot forward as an example to the younger girls on my team of living a healthy lifestyle.So I've gradually recovered since then. My senior year and final season, I was still not exactly where I should've been but gradually on the rise. My weight alone was never an easy metric to track, as being a swimmer, I've always had to maintain a fair amount of muscle. It was my body fat percentage that drastically needed the improvement, as I had been working with our athletic trainers.Long story short: I retired from my final season (and closed out with personal bests in all of my events if you want a happy ending! :D) and have entered the workforce as a normal person. About 4 months ago, I finally got my period back after about 2.5 years. Here's the tricky part and I would love if someone could weigh in.I'm fully weight restored in a healthy range, but a little over what I consider close for comfort. Since my period has started, my hormones have definitely been completely wild (it's like being a teenager all over again with random acne). I've definitely gotten curvier (which I love, because I'm used to being a broad-shouldered swimmer lol - now I'm more feminine!) but I'll admit lately I've been trying to stall the weight gain with old habits. I'm trying to get a grasp on normal life with light activity around work, not my typical high intensity training. I just want to maintain at this point (and have some of the fat on my belly redistribute) but it feels like my metabolism is still wonky. My hands are still freezing, I'm still having dramatic GI distress (excessive bloating, constipation, acid reflux), my vitals are all still much lower than average, my adrenals ramp up out of nowhere. I've been much happier and healthier feeling, but I'm concerned that if I continue this "normal, balanced diet" I will only continue to gain and I am a healthy limit where I don't need to gain anymore weight. It's really tempting to fall back into old habits and I'm worried that maybe these attempt have stalled my metabolism.Would love if anyone can weigh in or lend insight here - has anyone experienced this and can give me advice? Is this normal in weight-restoration? Does it ever get better / regulate itself? Is it just because my hormones are still going all over the place? I just want to maintain without thinking or worrying and getting all systems going again like normal! Will it work itself out? I'm concerned I'm just going to continue to gain.So sorry that this was so long - really appreciate anyone who actually read through the whole novel! :)

column5: Every day is so hard right now. I am struggling with exhaustion and not feeling well. Work is beyond stressful and i am just spent i got turned down from a cashier job. like i have done that type of work before i still got turned down not even an interview. I just see no way out and i am just so done. i can't do this anymore. my depression with my new medication and trying to turn things more positive is helping a little its just life. i was off track on eating now i got back on track which is good. I am trying to drink more fluid because my doctor was all over me last week threatening to send me to the er if i did not improve. why is it so hard. my ptsd is also terrible i am not sleeping well from nightmares...
column9: hermione3 - We're so sorry to hear that you're struggling and feeling overwhelmed. We are concerned, and want to make sure you're safe. Please contact the Suicide Hotline if you are feeling suicidal at 800-273-TALK. The NEDA Helpline is another resource that you can use. They are trained volunteers that can offer you support in a judgment free environment (1800.931.2237 M-TH 9-9 EST and F 9-5 EST). I hope things begin to get back on track. Please continue to stay strong and don’t give up.  - Forum Moderators

column5: I was doing so well. depression is really hitting me hard. i have no motivation to prepare food let alone eat anything. I just hate this I hope the medication change makes a different and also i have to make some changes myself like trying to be more positive which i am doing. i just feel i am so deep in it i can't get out. i am hurting and it is exhausting.
column9: Hi hermione3, Because your post mentions health concerns, the following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit or any other serious medical concerns.If you experience anything above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.Thank you, take care.  - NEDA moderators
column13: Hi hermione3,   We are concerned for your safety and want to make sure you're safe. Since you mentioned self-harm, please do not hesitate to contact the self-injury crisis line at 1-800-366- 8288 or by texting “NEDA” to 741-741 if you're struggling with this. Thanks, and please take care!

column5: Hello everyone! I am new to this forum, so I will just give a little info about myself. I am 36 years old, but my battle with anorexia began at 20 years old. In short, I made a full recovery when I was 22 years old, regaining my weight and health, as well as my period. In 2014, I fell back into old habits to cope with new stress, and I relapsed back into anorexia. I lost a dangerous amount of weight, and I also lost my period again. Over the course of 2018 until now, I have gained back some much-needed weight. My body composition isn't the best, as I gained weight by eating whatever and whenever I wanted. But I have not had a period since 2014. I have had blood tests done recently, and my hormone levels tested as normal. But being that I am 36 years old, and I still do not have a period, I am a little worried. Is this normal or something I should be concerned about? Anyone else in the same boat? Thank you!
column8: Dear OLLAY, we are glad you
column9: Dear OLLAY, we are glad you reached out! We edited your post slightly to remove mention of specific numbers that can be triggering to other forum members. You can find our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. You can also reach out to the NEDA Helpline for treatment options (https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/help-support/contact-helpline).

column4: (22 F) am i subconsciously keeping my old habits??
column5: I developed anorexia when I was about 14, and after going through extensive therapy, I've considered myself to be in recovery for the past 3 years. However, while I haven't had thoughts of restriction or made any conscious effort to keep my weight down, I'm finding that even with the addition of certain foods, my weight has been very low. It's above my weight when I was sick, but nowhere near where I feel I should be for my height. I think the thing that's really holding me back is my inability to eat large portions of food. Where I am right now, I can't manage much more than a child's size portion of almost anything. When I eat to over-fullness, I get extremely uncomfortable and nauseated. I've been told it's a mental block, and I've also been told my stomach has shrunk. I'm concerned my tiny portions are sabotaging my effort to get better. Has anyone else physically struggled with eating normal amounts of food after recovery? Am I just not as far along in recovery as I thought I was?? Please help!
column9: Dear chickadee, we are glad you reached out! We edited your post slightly to remove mention of specific foods that can be triggering to other forum members. You can find our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. You can also reach out to the NEDA Helpline for treatment options (https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/help-support/contact-helpline).

column5: I had a good session with my psychiatrist she changed my medication and i am starting it tomorrow as it won't be at the pharmacy until tomorrow and she said to give that at least a month and if it doesn't change she has a plan for what to do next. i feel positive about it and she told me to talk to my therapist about how i felt yesterday. I ended up self-harming last night because i was just so angry and hurt and i know its not my therapists fault i was just so upset and felt so awful. i wasn't going to tell anyone but my psychiatrist asked and i just felt i shouldn't lie that won't help me. it won't hurt my therapist i just hurt myself and i know that is on me. i hope the medication change helps she asked me if i felt how i did when i went inpatient last year and i said yes i feel about that bad. i also said i feel i get dismissed because i am able to go to work and stuff so it seems like i am functional but really it is just on a limited bases i can do what i have to do. my psychiatrist even said i should contact my therapist sooner we have a good relationship and she knows we can work through this. like i need tough love sometimes but right now it just isn't working for me it just makes me feel lazy and like my depression is nothing. like i could get up and do something but it feels i can't and i can't focus and that is why my psychiatrist picked the medication she did based on how i feel and she has a plan if it doesn't work out so i feel a little better that she is on board with everything.
column9:
Dear hermione3, You mentioned that you have self-harmed. We are concerned about your safety.This number is really important to have: (800)-273-8255 or text "NEDA" to 741741 immediately for support.You can also find immediate support through these websites:
Please be safe!

column4: Recovery and parotid swelling and stones
column5:
I have been in recovery for 3 years and am proud and the point I stand now, a healthy body weight, strength and more mental stability than ever in the past but I still have circumstances and emotional battles that make some days or weeks harder than others and find myself falling back into bumemic behavuours. My faith and family and spouse have been my saving grace and as my faith continues to grow so does my love for myself.
I am a devote athlete and began gymnastics at 7, which within 5 years develope anorexia. It's been a lifetime of ups and down, but now as I reach 40 have a different appreciation for life and know how valuable my life is.My question is through the years of purging I have developed so I've been told an autoimmune disorder which I belief is brought on by the ED, the swelling of my parotids is so severe and does not only happen in purging boughts, but when healthy eating behaviors are occurring, it's become extremely painful and relentless. Dr have advised me to go through lots of testing and possibly that I have salivary stones. I have been successful with the advice to aliviate swelling and pain with medications and hot compress and LOTS of sour candy but this too is no longer having much affect and causing distress. I find soup for weeks and lots of acid help resolve pain and swelling but the moment I indroduce anything which has sodium or requires intense chewing I flare....ANY suggestions or help with this are welcomed and appreciated.
column9: Dear Beccabb39, we are glad you reached out! We would like to remind you that any kind of advice is not allowed on NEDA forums. You can find our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. You can also reach out to the NEDA Helpline for treatment options (https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/help-support/contact-helpline).

column5: Hi everyone, I'm new here. After following Jesus for a few months I felt moved to lay down my pride yesterday, and what I realized is that the eating disorders of my teen years that I thought I was "over" are very much still a part of me, only secretly.What I mean by that is I no longer intentionally restrict my food intake or binge or purge in order to achieve a certain size. But I don't exactly make eating full meals a priority either.For example, if I am sleepy and hungry at the same time, I choose sleep over cooking every time. I just don't have the motivation to cook food.And whenever I'm really hungry and involved in an activity that I really like, I only eat the minimal amount I need to in order to get rid of the hunger pangs, and then I go back to what I'm doing.Food is more like an inconvenience rather than a source of joy and nourishment, but I don't exactly hate food either.But somehow I've been able to maintain a normal weight and BMI. Because I'm a kidney donor I see doctors routinely but no one is concerned. The only reason why I even considered there must be a problem is because I get migraines and get sick routinely.Does anybody else have a similar relationship to food?I'm committed to recovery and I've contacted NEDA and they are working to find me faith-based counselors, programs, and dietitians. I'm thinking a big first step would be to get a simple meal-plan designed for me that I can stick to and follow. If anyone out there who has been where I am has any advice about my next steps I'd greatly appreciate hearing it.SetapartforJesus
column9: Hi HaianhJumi,  Your post has been edited slightly, as it contained comments that may not be helpful, or may trigger other users. We do not allow medical or nutritional advice here on the forums. column5: Having a really rough day just depressed still. I sent a text to my psychiatrist yesterday saying it has not improved after my period and waiting to hear back. My therapist sent her a text too. I might message again tonight when I get out of work but it’s just hard to do anything. I am going to work but it’s a struggle. I just don’t want to do anything but sleep. I hate I am still eating and my weight keeps creeping up I just am sick of everything like why am I even trying I don’t think I am binging but I snack a little extra sometimes and I feel guilty. Work has been rough but trying not to complain to my therapist about work because she doesn’t want to hear that. I get that I am just overwhelmed with everything I am going to break I want to restrict I highly considered it today and I want to cut and j just don’t want to fight I am but I am tired...and just depressed.
column9:

We know you are in the care of both your therapist and psychiatrist, but this number is really important to have: (800)-273-8255 or text "NEDA" to 741-741 immediately for support.  You can also find immediate support through these websites:

column4: [46 yr. old, M] In recovery from bulimia for four years and still experiencing digestive issues and trouble getting to a healthy
column5:
I became bulimic at the age of thirteen. I was a chubby, but not obese kid, and purged for over thirty years, through all of my teen years, and my twenties. By the time I hit thirty though, it started to work in reverse, and I gained a significant amount of weight, no matter how much I purged.
Four years ago, I made the decision to stop. I saw myself through recovery, which was tough, and I lost most of my excess weight slowly through diet and exercise. I continue to exercise daily, and eat healthily. I drink plenty of water and eat more fruits and vegetables now than I ever have in my life. However, I seemed to have hit a plateau on my weight loss, and I think it might have something to do with my digestive system not working properly. For three decades, I have kept my digestive system from functioning properly, and four years later after giving up purging, I am still experiencing intestinal distress, severe bloating and distention of my abdomen, and constipation.
Has anyone in recovery experienced this? What have you done to make your body function healthily again? Were you ever able to lose weight in a healthy manner after you stopped binging and purging? I feel healthy, and much better now that I have left the bulimia behind me, but the body issues still remain, and so do the digestive issues. I see a gastroenterologist at the end of the month to discuss this. Are there any specific questions that I should ask them? Will my body ever forgive me for what I have done to it, and go back to some state of normalcy? I’m very depressed about this, and I’m terrified that I will never get back to a healthy weight.
column8: Hi Lister, and welcome to the

column5: I am a 22yo female with blue hair. And I looked at the scale today at work. I am not thin. Even before recovery I wasn't thin, more curvy or "normal". Now I am disgusting. The number on the scale makes me want to cry. It makes me want to go home and hide in my bed with my cat, where I can't see the distended fleshiness of my thighs. It makes me want to run until I can't breathe and my whole body hurts from the lack of oxygen. It makes me want to scream until I can't feel my throat, and just stop eating. But then I hear my therapist's voice, talking about how the weight'll start to come off once my body is no longer confused and in crisis. And if I believe that, then what does that mean I can do with the number left behind? I have to live with it and try to do better, rather than harming myself with an unsustainable overcorrection.

column5: I know my therapist said it was or is PMS but really i feel self destructive and miserable. I see my psychiatrist Thursday and therapist Wednesday so I can be honest about how i feel. I am just down and out. I was thinking of going off my meds again which i know is not a good idea but the thought came...i want to cut i haven't in over a year and i am still maintaining 100% of my meal plan it is just exhausting. just praying for snow because the thought of work tomorrow is just making it worse. i want to just not go in i am wanting to just stay in bed. I want to be physically sick because part of me is ashamed of my mental illness like i could call out but i did a week ago and i lost my 180 hours of sick time last year when i took my medical leave again for mental health. i crash i feel it is not getting better maybe it is not pms maybe it is more maybe it is still hormonal i don't know. what is the point.

column5: I've been feeling really depressed over the past couple of days and I'm trying to put on a mask and pretend like everything's okay and I'm just so tired of everything. I love my family but I have such repressed anger and resentment of the childhood that was basically taken from me. I don't know, I'm just really not in a great mental space and it doesn't help that I'm continuing harming behaviors and ED behaviors. I just feel like I'm stuck in a vicious cycle of just behaviors. but something positive is that I have my first meeting with a dietician this week as well as my therapist, so that's something to maybe look forward too. I just don't know anymore. I'm feeling really lonely these days.

column5: So I’ve been gaining some weight and I tried to like put on my jeans and it was tight around the thigh/waist area and I just went into an anxiety spiral and weighed myself and I’m so much bigger than I thought so I’m just not having a good day and I don’t even feel like eating  anymore and I want To go back to purging

column5: Today has been okay so far, nothing bad as happened or triggered as far as I can tell. Breakfast and lunch weren’t a problem. But dinner is soon, and I suddenly find myself in the mindset I was in when I first started treatment and would cry during or after meals. The way I felt about myself after. I want to refuse dinner and I feel like I might end up crying and I honestly don’t know where this is coming from. A lot of feelings from when I was a teenager and the things that were happening at home and the other trauma I was carrying around those secrets and I had to live a double life and compartmentalize the trauma in order to put on a facade at school and in public. The turmoil and stress of keeping those things stuffed inside feels like it’s suddenly tearing me apart. I don’t get this because I already dealt with this in therapy. And I know it’s not always that simple as you work on something and it never comes up again. I just don’t get any of this. And I’m getting really intense derealization episodes which is a common trauma reaction for me. I just want to not feel this way about food again

column5:
i am new to this.
i don’t understand how much i should eat and how much i should exercise. for 4 months i have overexcercised everyday and eaten a set amount of calories. i am always dizzy/lightheaded/pale/irritable and i lost my period. i am 14 years old so technically still supposed to be growing & stuff.
i am trying to eat more calories but i still overexcise and i HATE the bloating and am terrified of gaining weight.
what do you think i should do?? i want to commit to recovery...

column13: Hi roseanxne, we're sorry to hear that you're struggling and you had mentioned some concerning symptoms so we wanted to post up some more signs and symptoms of a medical emergency. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience any of the above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.

column4: Going to a support group next week?
column5: I used to go to a support group meeting every week. It’s a support group for any mental health conditions. It helped me feel like I wasn’t alone in my depression and anxiety. However, a year and a half ago, after a trauma occurred, I stopped going for a long time. I ended up going back, but then the meetings started to be more about fundraising than being an actual support group and I left feeling almost worse than before so I stopped going. My friend whose mom recently died, asked me if I wanted to go with her next week to see how if the meetings are better now, and I honestly almost said no right away. But I decided I would go at least to give her support with all that she’s gone through. I feel like I can’t talk about my ptsd but especially my eating disorder there because nobody else at the meetings I’ve been to has an ED and when I’ve brought it up in the past, even the facilitator had no clue about it. But I am going to talk about my ED, because it is a mental illness just like any other. And maybe it will help educate others on the reality of eating disorders, especially the person who runs the meetings. I’m just nervous about going back.
column9: Dear tryingtobebrave,We are wirting to inform you that your post was slightly edited to take out the support group name. Sharing of specific treatment facilities and support group names are not allowed on the forums. Thanks for your understanding and please keep sharing!

column5: I feel like I want to scream and crawl out of my skin....I am on day 12 of following my meal plan I am proud of myself but I am so bloated and constipated...just feeling miserable and want to go restricting but I’m not I just hate this feeling I feel like food is just piling on top of food... I hate this feeling. I hate my body

column5: I'm so tired of dealing with my past.  It just makes me want to give up.  Last night I dreamt that I was sexually attacked.  It reminded me of my past.  I'm just tired.

column5: I've been bulimic since I was 13. I'm now 30 years old and have just completed 8 days in recovery. I feel like this is it..I can really do it this time.  I've been on anti-anxiety medication since I was 19, and was recently diagnosed with depression and OCD. Bulimia is linked directly to my anxiety.I just now ate a certain kind of food and stopped when I was full, not when it was gone. I don't think I've ever in my life not finished the food in front of me. Now, as I sit on the couch folding laundry and listening to Netflix in the background, my whole body seems to vibrate with the knowledge that there is still that certain kind of food in the fridge. A warm hug of need and want. I know how this goes...I know where this path leads. It doesn't stop there. After I eat the certain kind of food, there would be a furious scavenge through the kitchen for more. Fast forward an hour from now, I'll be back on the couch folding laundry, but this time shaking and weak from purging. Yet, the certain kind of food is still in the fridge. I'm keeping my hands busy with a sewing project and working through the extreme temptation to walk to the kitchen. Just to look. Just to see if there's anything worth eating. No. Not this time. I am finally in a place where  can tell myself that I deserve better and I believe it. My therapist told me 'Imagine a world without your anxiety and bulimia.' I'm finally able to. Stay strong my friends.

column5: Whenever something that would normally be considered mildly stressful or just annoying happens, my mind just gets so stressed and overwhelmed that it shuts down. Like today, my phone battery started having problems and I need to get it replaced this weekend, it’s under warranty, shouldn’t be a big deal, but it’s making me feel so stressed out my body physically can’t relax. I’ve always had this problem and it makes me feel worthless, like maybe I don’t deserve to eat. Or that restricting is the only way to make me feel better/ in control. I know these thoughts are irrational. And I made myself eat today, no matter how much I didn’t want to. I know I need to be vigilant right now with my thoughts with all the increase in ED thoughts lately. I’m just getting down on myself for being so overwhelmed by every little thing.

column5: Hi.  I am hurting so much.  I am dealing with a new diagnosis, something I have been searching for, a reason for my physical pain.  I now have answers.  It also is a reason I have anxiety, sleeplessness, and depression.  Pain throughout my body.  Dizziness and headaches.  All of these now have a reason.  But the more difficult thing or equally as difficult is my emotional pain.  Being so misunderstood by family members.  Mistreated by the one I live with. I have been doing pretty well with the eating, some stress eating but not binging.  I stay up way late and then am over tired come morning.  Work makes my pain worse but I have to work to keep my Medicaid.  My emotion comes out as anger.  Anger at not being able to live in my own house without constant turmoil.  And anger from my Mom when she gets frustrated with me for not agreeing with everything she says.  She gets angry and yells at me.  We are fine until I don't agree with her.  Then she starts raising her voice and then I am wrong because I don't agree with what she is saying.  I am just so ready to move, but I can't.  My therapist wants me to.  An example of my sister.  She tells me we "promised" each other that we wouldn't go to bed angry with each other.  She said I have broken that promise as I have not spoken to her about when we have a fight.  I told her that I was not comfortable with talking with her as I feel she is mean to me and we get no where.  She said I broke our promise.  Later the next day I called her, left a message and said we agreed to see my therapist when you were feeling better. I came home and she said yes she got my message, after I asked her.  She said she was not going back to my therapist because she didn't like her. I then told her you are breaking your promise.  She said she would not see her.  Today she explained it wasn't that she didn't like her, she didn't like her approach. I asked her to explain.  She said she didn't like it when I started screaming at her in the office, my therapist did not tell me to stop screaming. I told my sister I didn't scream at her. She said all the people in the other rooms could here you you were screaming so loud.  And she said she didn't like that my therapist said it was okay for me to talk with my parent's when we had a problem.  My sister just wants it to be us but that doesn't work.  She keeps bringing up how I walk away when I don't like what is being said and I say I don't want to talk about it.  She doesn't realize she does this and shuts me down all the time.  I did do this a few times many months ago.  She has been in her room and hasn't said things that trigger my PTSD as she did when I walked away from her and I talked to her about why I did what I did.  She doesn't remember this though.  She told me she would see another therapist but not mine.  So I called one and am waiting for the call back, although my sister told me she would not go on an ongoing basis, she would go once or twice.  I said that isn't going to work. We need to go until the therapist thinks we are able to work things out on our own.  She repeated she wouldn't go for more than one or two times.  I said you are not keeping your commitment, to go to therapy with me.  My therapist told me today that I did not scream at my sister.  So I am desperate.  I am lonely.  Angry.  Sad.Thank you for listening.iwanttolive  ps  I am safe
column9: Hi iwanttolive, We're sorry that you are feeling so alone and hopeless right now! I'm glad that you reached out to the forums. We're concerned for your safety and we want you to be safe. Please contact the Suicide Hotline if you are feeling suicidal at 800-273- TALK. It also sounds like you are experiencing a medical emergency, so please reach out to a medical professional or contact 911 as soon as possible!

I go from drinking a certain amount, to restricting certain types of drinks. It's really way too much. Does anyone have tips for other coping skills?

column5:
Hello! This is my first topic. Briefly, I suffered from anorexia for almost 2 years and have been in recovery since January 2018. I restricted on almost every foss and went from a certain amount of weight (I have nevee been obese) to a certain amount of weight and entered a hospital. Unfortunately, I did not receive an adequate treatment and I started my recovery at home, alone, with the help of my family (I am 17 years old). Today, I exercise very frequently and want to be fit and healthy but  I also have started binging very frequently for the past month. It starts like a normal eating but I end up binging on a variety of different foods. I eat enormous quantities of the thinfs I have been restricting for almost 2 years. I started gaining weight, of course, and lost all of the self-confidence that I had obtained during recovery. I try to stop but I can not. After binging I feel very embarrassed and of course have stomach aches but they do not stop me from doing exactly the same thing on the next day. Have you experienced that, anorexia fighters? How can I cope with it?
:( :( :(
